Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you I am a housewife, not a 'pro'.  I love to take fotos and will use the camera for family shots, vacations, and memorie making. I shopped for a 'bridge' camera for 6 months!  The main items I was looking for were  a long zoom, a viewfinder, and ability to attach a filter.  I researched and debated between this camera and the Sony DSC-HX100.  My last 2 cameras were Sonys and I had been happy, but decided to be open minded and do the research.  I wanted a step up from the pocket models but did not want to go back to dealing with carrying and changing lens'. In the end, the reason I chose this camera over the Sony was #1 cost, I could not see paying an extra $75 for the Sony , and the accessories were also more costly and #2, years ago I had a Canon AE1-and was happy with it, and well, Canon makes cameras-so I deceded to give it a try and go back to Canon.  I was happy I did.I took the camera with us on a cruise, and well, so far so very happy!!  Downloading the 200+ pages of the owners manual was a headache, wish they had included one, but you will need it!!  I have not even begun to 'touch' on what this camera is capable of doing and did not do any movies.  But, here are the points I have been happy with / and or not so happy with;-It is a little heavy, from what I am used to, and I am not yet comfortable with the 'grip' .  My hand keeps 'bumping' the knobs and "things' happen-the night setting (in the SCN) works fantastic...with no flash, the low lighting works great-good image stabilization, not too many blurry fotos-the macro has been hard for me to 'figure out', but like I said, the manual is huge...so I have not yet been comfortable and happy with the macro fotos I have taken of flowers-the SPORTS setting for movement, appears to go slower than my Sony used to.  When you hold the button down, there seems to be a bit fo a lag-the flash is not strong.  I do like that you must manually raise or lowere, because I loke to be in control.  I may look at adding an external flash in the future...which you can do on this camera-I played with the color settings, as in b/w, sepia, vivid, etc.  these setting worked really well-I bought the filter adapter--do this!  Especially, if you plan on  beaqch scens, being able to attach a ppolarizing filter is a 'must'.  the adpater attached easily, once you took a minute to learn to do it correctly.  The negative is that the lens cap does not fit on with the adapter-"Trimming" works well in blowing up just a face in a foto...I have not played with any of the computer accesories yet, but within the camera, I am happyOverall, in the end, I am happy with the camera.  I am saying 'wow' more than I am saying "I regret"....Value for price paid-very good.  Amazon and the other sellers I bought from, performedf and delivered as they said.  I did purchase the Amazon company warranty, but hopefully will not have the need to review it!!  Have fun shopping and hope my insights have helped...everyone leses that I read di help me make the final decision.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX 40 HS - Review
Reviews.Author: Girish
Reviews.Content: This camera has been amazing for the short duration I used it so far. I bought this just before the thanksgving weekend and in two days time I went for a chicago trip. The camera helped me to capture Chicago very well and definitely put the 35X to full use. The range of shots that can be taken increases dramatically with 35X and I end up spending lot of time to capture most of them, It was indeed very fun! The video recording for this cam is very good and it works very well even in low light conditions.I have recommened this cam to couple of my friends and so far they are also very happy with it. You will never go wrong with Canon SX 40 HS.

Reviews.Title: WOW... Impressive!
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I must thank Amazon for bringing the HX40 HS to the market before the time advertised for it's release. Delivery was within two days of it's schedule and customer service for this specific product was quite professional. This allowed me to take on my holiday (to England) a camera with specifications I've been longing for. I have owned other super- zooms but none have given me the image quality and handeling as the Canon SX40 HS. Where it lacks is in the poor resolution of it's lcd and viewfinder. The hand grip also need re-designing since it's too east for your finger to accidently toggle the zoom device. Regardless, I have no reservation in highly recommending this product.

Reviews.Title: Great VFM (Value For Money)
Reviews.Author: Raj
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX40 delivers quiet a punch for the price you pay. The picture clarity is great, the zoom is just magnificent, easy to use, image stabilizer is excellent!! Great if you are graduating from a basic point and shoot camera and do not want to lug around a SLR or pay the price of one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn Baker
Reviews.Content: Very happy.  Works great - the 35X zoom is fantastic, but only works when set to full auto.  Great as a birding camera and hiking, as it's fairly powerful but light.

Reviews.Title: Great African Safari Pictures
Reviews.Author: ohioengineer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use on an African safari and it performed like a champ.  I have received numerous compliments on my pictures and I am just an amatuer photographer.PROS: - Easy to use.  With animals in the bush country you often have just seconds to get your shot.  With this camera I never missed an opportunity. - Takes great pictures.  It focuses quickly and adjusts for light automatically and quickly.  I took pictures while standing in the noonday equitorial sun while my subject was in the deep shade and the camera knew exactly what to do. - 35x power lens is great.  I took fantastic close-ups of animals that I could barely see with my naked eye.  At full extension, the lens is hard to hold steady but sitting the camera on a beanbag solves this. - Also takes great videos.  I had never used a video camera before, but with just the push of a button this camera records action. - Good image stabilization.  I took a number of pictures as our 4x4 sped down very bumpy roads and most of them turned out sharp. - Robust.  The African heat, dust and terrible roads never bothered this camera.CONS: - No camera bag.  I couldn't find a decent bag to fit this camera.  I ended up carrying it in my backpack and this worked fine. - Shutter speed can be a little slow, especially if you are trying to capture moving objects.  However, using the "sport" setting allows you to click off pictures fairly quickly.BOTTOM LINE:Overall a great camera and one I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent clarity and detail... Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Joe Machuta
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with my Canon SX40HS. It has met and exceeded my expectations. I shoot a lot of landscapes and it creates clear crisply focused images. If you use the SCN setting you get clarity throughout the photo from foreground to the deepest reaches of the photo. Color is great. It makes very good HDR images... that is how I edit most of my photos. Portraits are very crisp with excellent detail. I shoot it almost every day. I participate on an online social media website which displays people's photos and mine rate up there with the best of them!

Reviews.Title: Better than Most, Rival with the Pro Cameras Twice the Price
Reviews.Author: ReynerN
Reviews.Content: I love good quality pictures and have purchased quite a few small cameras (the kind you put in your pocket). Sometime they're ok, sometime not so much depending on the lighting. So, just to make sure we have a good camera for our next cruise, I bought this camera after reading a lot of good reviews about it. I'm glad I purchase this camera. For the price, the quality rivals to camera twice its price (I've seen the picture produced by $25K camera and it's not much difference). I really appreciate the fact that the shutter speed is fast and it worked under low light so well that it brought me great joy!The flip screen saved me a lot from difficult position and it can be the saving grace from taking a good picture from different angle. Also, the battery life is quite good. I took about 300 (1080p quality) pictures before I need to recharge the battery. But, if you use flash a lot, you may want to have a spare battery.I found that this camera was quite popular too. I saw 2 other people during the cruise that used the exact same camera. It also takes good quality video (with sound). Many people said, "Wow, nice camera!" after they took our pictures (my wife and I).There are many features that have been discussed in the previous reviews. If you were like me (who didn't want to spend too much but want to have a quality camera that will not disappoint), I recommend this camera. I've done a lot of research and I'm very happy with my decision.

Reviews.Title: perfect all-around camera!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Wlassak
Reviews.Content: I',ve purchased this camera through a friend who travelled to USA, Nex York, on march, this year. He passed on B&H; store and got a SX40 Canon for me, with 32 SDHC high speed card and extra battery. Since it arrived in my hands, I took more than 1000 pictures, and can say that 90% are still stored on my computer. The 10 % were discharged due to blurr or some errors of myself, trying new capabilities of the camera. That is the learning and adapting process... I have another camera, a DSLR (Pentax k-r with kit lens)witch is very good. But my favourite camera now is the sx40. flexibility, powerful zoom, low-light capabilities, fast shooting.Iwould recommend it to anyone who likes photography, even DSLR owners... I use it a lot on my job as police officer in Brazil. Evidences, investigation... zoom, it is very useful!

Reviews.Title: Canon XS40, Great Camera and Super Zoom for the money.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D. Middleton "beth12075"
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Camera with a Super Zoom Lens for the money, you can't go wrong on this camera, If your on the fence, just "BUY IT" you will be happy you did.......

Reviews.Title: High end point and shoot and super zoom
Reviews.Author: I. Nesbeth
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon  and it has lived up to all my expectations.  I was really  thinking about a DSLR,  but if I had bought  a Rebel, I would  still have to buy an additional  lens  to improve the versatility.  This is one camera , with one lens that has the best of both worlds (close ups and extreme zooms).  It is the best  bridge between  point and shoot and  Extreme (Not Beginner) DSLR.  I would definitely recommend this camera, before buying a beginner DSLR (although the manual settings are a bit limited).  The image quality is great, and you will be impressed with the versatility.

Reviews.Title: excellent almost all in one camera camcorder
Reviews.Author: A. mehran
Reviews.Content: Bought it after a so so short term experience with SX30 which I returned to  costco. This camera is far better than the other one. The major SX30 problems were focus and indoor pictures being yellow. I was looking for a fully auto-for-dummies camera after my old Canon powershot died after many years. It had to have swivel screen. I was hoping for a video recording camera too This Canon fulfills it all. THe indoor pix are great including without flash. Of course not as sharp as the true SLRs since this is NOT an SLR despite its size. The zoom is excellent. the Video quality is excellent too as is its audio. The only down side is that if you take a picture while video'ing, the video will have a pause in it.  I am really impressed with this camera. If you are like me i.e. take pictures during trips or events and  are total dummy as far as aperture and F numbers and that kind of stuff is concerned: you will like this camera. Finally, the pictures come out just as good when viewed on a computer and when printed.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS
Reviews.Author: Joan Hanna "Gary Hanna"
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX40 HS has an excellent lens.  I am amazed that a lens that long will focus up close.  It is a great light weight small travel camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera fills the gap between point and shoot and DSLR
Reviews.Author: Kael Blackwood
Reviews.Content: This camera has some pretty amazing qualities. The 35X optical zoom allows you to stand fairly far off from a subject and still get excellent close images, useful when the situation doesn't allow you to get as close as you'd need to with a P&S;, or an DSLR without a very long lens. It does have some creative limitations, but it's not a DSLR and doesn't pretend to be. The image stabilization allows clear hand held shots at very low light situations. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the images I got of a full moon with the lens zoomed all the way in (into the digital zoom range) details of the moon's surface are clear, hand held. It's not a substitute for a DSLR, but it's a huge step up from a P&S.; It's light and compact, so you can carry it around all day without noticing it. When you buy it, be sure to get the filter adaptor and a UV filter (they're much cheaper online than at your local camera shop), you need the adaptor in order to use filters on this camera, they do not just screw on to the lens barrel. If you're a DSLR user and want a nice "knock around camera", one you carry everywhere just in case that shot presents itself, this is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: Happy SX40 owner!
Reviews.Author: Anne E Bogaev
Reviews.Content: I am a complete novice at photography and bought the camera mainly to aid in identifying birds in the field (bird watcher)and for casual vacation trips.  After a few days, I am quite pleased with the quality of pictures (butterflies, birds, etc.) and ease of use.  Camera seems to do good in relatively low light and long distances.  Bird pictures I get from it are sometimes better than the view I get from my expensive binoculars.  A great camera, particularly if one does not want to carry around a heavy SLR.  This camera takes a Canon NB-10L battery and not not the Canon NB-7L used in the SX30.  I accidently ordered the NB-7L ($6)for my SX40 camera and it is too big.  I am having trouble at this point of finding an inexpensive NB-10L battery (about $64 at Amazon).  Any ideas or is it just a matter of waiting a few months for cheaper replacement batteries to show up on the market?

Reviews.Title: Focus too slow
Reviews.Author: Manfish
Reviews.Content: I was forced to return this camera because the time it takes to focus is extremely slow, sometimes more than a second and this is on stationary subjects! Moving subjects are much more difficult and in some cases, I missed the subject completely. Unfortunately, the remaining fine qualities of the camera cannot compensate for this focus problem.

Reviews.Title: Good...but not the best superzoom...
Reviews.Author: Gladius
Reviews.Content: Many reviews I read (Canon or not) compare a new model to an old one made by the same manufacturer.  I don't find these reviews very helpful.For example, the SX40 is better than the SX30. I'm glad it is (better sensor, Digic 5) and it's an excellent camera.  35x is really very impressive  (Note: Be ready to sometimes use a tripod if you get this due to blur --- not unexpected at 35x!  :-).  Pics are usually remarkably free of blur.  Colors are good.  IQ is good.  IS is good.  (Overall, good picture quality and average video/audio.)I love Canon.  But the Panasonic FZ150 has all of the above (except 24x lens) and more.  It's faster.  The EVF is better.  Video is better (1080 x24p vs. 1080 x60p for the Panasonic --- and more control).  The screen is 460,000 not an outdated 230,000 and a bit larger.  Battery life is somewhat better.  OIS is even better than that on the SX40.  It has RAW.  (Note:  Both cameras are better than the Nikon P500/510.)  (I've used all of them.)The Panasonic does cost somewhat more but resale would be better and the Panasonic should not be out of date for quite a while.I don't really want to spend about $489 on a P&S;, no matter how good.  But it's not being discounted for a reason.  And best to get it right the first time.In this case the FZ150 is the best superzoom out there.  I advise trying both before making your decision (the SX40 is right now significantly cheaper).  Don't be tied to any one brand!  (And I do consider Canon the best brand overall.)  Look at the brand (reliability, customer service) and the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Angelfire
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Previously as a professional photographer I carried a larger SLR camera and lenses with me on vacation. Those cameras and lenses and heavy and cumbersome to bring from place to place and keep a constant eye on as you travel. I switched from the professional larger cameras to a point and shoot for about a year, but found that focus was slow on the point and shoot and I lacked creativity because everything was set for me. The Canon SX40 meets all my needs. The focus is quick and sharp, the focal length is great. The images are beautiful, and I have the flexibility to change the f-stop and time value as needed. It is small enough to fit into a purse, and the viewing screen allows you to easily compose your images. I use this camera daily to create images in my world!

Reviews.Title: Pleasant Surprise
Reviews.Author: Wayne R. Crauder
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  I use an ILC usually.  I know the picture quality is good for a superzoom compact camera.  Testing I liked the quality better than the SX50.  Even at this lower zoom, it is near the useful practical limit.  At the full zoom, it will show the air and heat waves rising which can blur the photo.  What surprised me was when I took it to a Nationwide night race at Kentucky Speedway. It focused much quicker than I expected it to.  With the zoom, I could take photos all around the 1½ mile track.  The photos had lower noise than I expected and lower than the SX50.  I was able to get photos under this condition that will little editing printed at 11X14.  Tracking is not as good as some other cameras as this is not the strong point of these cameras.  Still I got some photos of a NASCAR race with the cars at full speed.  The video was well exposed and focus decent throughout.  There was more noise in the video than the stills.  However when I looked at the replay on TV, the noise was about the same as the broadcast had.  Looking to get another one for me to use when I do not want to carry all the lenses.  For posting via internet, viewing on HD or 4K TV, it does well.  8X10 prints will look great.  Many photos can be printed at 11X14.  Price/quality ratio is very high.  Well above average for a camera of this type.

Reviews.Title: Victim of Feature Creep
Reviews.Author: Richard Stewart
Reviews.Content: Having a swivel screen is invaluable for taking pictures over the heads of crowds.The image stabilization works well.The wide range zoom is very useful.Batteries last a long time.The results are sufficient for my uses, but there are features I have never been able to use because they are not intuitive, and I do not carry around a computer so that I can look up the instructions online.I have yet to figure out how to use the macro settingWhen taking pictures of small details close up it usually does not focus automatically, and the procedure for manually setting focus while leaving exposure and shutter speed automatic still eludes me.Also, my primary use is taking pictures of cars at car shows, gatherings, and concours. Pictures of bright red cars taken with this camera come out with slightly orange highlights.

Reviews.Title: Great Bang for Your Buck!
Reviews.Author: Average Jane
Reviews.Content: Love this camera (overall)!Pros:  clear, crisp pics.  Awesome zoom for sports and far away nature/spontaneous shots.  See capturedbyjan.comFavorites: custom color that will pick up just one color out of a shot. Beautiful way to pick up blue eyes and a touch of color from sky, water or denim.Cons:  Good night and action shots, but difficult night action shots (ie.  evening football games).  I can't seem to keep out the blur from many of these shots.  Still shots on the field look great from the top of the stands.

Reviews.Title: love my camera
Reviews.Author: TammyK777
Reviews.Content: I don't have a lot to say about this camera, just that I've had it for almost 2 years now and totally love it!  Wonderful zoom, clear and beautiful pictures.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Portability and
Reviews.Author: ROGERIO MARQUES VASQUES
Reviews.Content: i bougth the Canon SX 40 about 1 year ago and have used it several times in different conditions.  This camera has a good quality/price ratio, you can carry it for every where, it is practical and I can make good pictures in good light conditions.  the zoom is amazing.You don't need anything else to shoot movies, movie's quality is great, image stabilization works as a charm and you can set up the camera for a variety of conditions.  Its was a nice buy.After a while, I decided it was time to upgrade to SLR, but I am keeping my SX40 for portability (when compared to SLR not to other compact cameras) and movies.

Reviews.Title: the zoom makes noise while video taping and ....
Reviews.Author: Vera Scroggins
Reviews.Content: camera is great in many ways and reasonable price, but the zoom makes noiseas I use it during videotaping.  This I find annoying and not a good feature.not sure what can be done about it and camera also turns off at about 16 mins. while videotaping and has to be restarted. another annoying feature.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: This camera is very user friendly and takes some very quality photographs without having to get attachments for it. Great for not so pro photographers!

Reviews.Title: Great camera and service after the sale:
Reviews.Author: K. Millsaps
Reviews.Content: The camera is more than I had expected it to be, as the optical Zoom is fantastic along with the intuitive nature of operating the controls.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Jena
Reviews.Content: I bought it as "refurbished" but the vendor said it was "**BRAND NEW**" in the ad, so I took a chance in order to save some money.  I'm glad I did.  I'm a dinosaur with a stubborn streak, so buying a digital camera was quite a tough decision.  I wanted a camera that was on par with my film camera (Canon AE-1 Program with several different lenses) but still had the "lazy factor" capabilities of a P&S...; AND it still had to take good natural and low-light pictures.  The camera itself is almost too sophisticated for what I expected.  The pictures are just fantastic for the non-flash, at night zoom, with the image stabilizer, and I haven't even read the manual yet.  Yeah...very pleased!!

Reviews.Title: Best friend when hiking in the rainforest
Reviews.Author: Alan S.
Reviews.Content: This reasonably compact mega-zoom takes stunning photos in the wild, and has enough manual controls to capture beautiful low light photos too.  I do wish the cycle time was a bit faster, but it's serviceable and the new models likely improve on it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Luis B.
Reviews.Content: Been using a lot of Canon cameras for a while, even DSLR... and a SX50. This one has excellent picture quality, beautiful colors, big display, lot of functions and the zoom... is amazing. The only basic difference with the SX50 HS is the zoom, if you can go for SX50 do it, if you dont need that much zoom you can stay with this one. Theyre both excellent cameras. With the image stabilization you'll always get sharp images.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its buck.
Reviews.Author: LUIS D. LAZALA
Reviews.Content: Beat camera ever had, it has more functionality than I need, very surprise of all it can do with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Crystal clear images
Reviews.Author: N. Sundarajan
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, great Canon camera! The pictures are crystal clear even when shot moving! I love the pop out screen option and the fact that this is made in Japan! The zoom is amazing! Love it!

Reviews.Title: New to Photography, Love this!
Reviews.Author: CamilleElise
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade my camera.I had a point and shoot.  I had my iPhone camera.  And then I started going to a place where I could shoot wildlife regularly, and it just wasn't cutting it.So I decided to upgrade.  But not making a lot, I had to do so on a budget.  The reviews for this were good, and so I took a gamble.Turns out the camera is great!  I have gotten some amazing shots, even using the scene settings.  I'm still learning the manual ones.  You can also manually set shutter speed, ISO, aperture.  I'm not there yet, but I am trying to learn.The zoom on this camera is great!  I got some close up pictures that show the ridges on the moon!  I have gotten pictures of hummingbirds with their wings visible while in flight.  I've been able to catch a hummingbird blinking, an owl in flight, a falcon in flight.  I also love the feature of holding down the shutter and taking multiple pictures.  Really helps with my action shots!  If you're new to the hobby and want a good camera to get started, this is it!The only con I have is that if you have too many pictures on the memory card, you have to buy a USB device to transfer images directly from the memory card.  You can't do it from the camera.  But that's when you have like 4000-5000 pictures on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Totally awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Glenn S.
Reviews.Content: Totally awesome camera especially for the money! This camera fixed the problems with the SX30. It performs in all aspects as you'd expect a Canon to perform. I won't go into a super technical review since those are out there. To have a 35x zoom in a camera like this is jaw dropping. I've had just about every Canon all in one since the S1IS. Back when 10x and maybe 20x was a big deal. The digital zoom is great. Video quality is great. Love the Digic processor. Blows away all other imagers from Sony and Nikon in my opinion. The camera leaves behind the AA power of old and now has a Canon battery. I do wish it still used AA batteries but I can understand the need for a special battery as power requirements increase.This camera is totally awesome and I'm looking forward to getting the SX50!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40
Reviews.Author: KATHLEEN BROWN
Reviews.Content: I have had several digital SLR cameras thru the years and the reason I was willing to pay the higher prices was versatility that the separate lens provided.  This Canon, altho not an SLR with changeable lenses, provides as much versatility without the bother of toting add'l lenses and switching them at often awkward times.Further the price you offered was better than I could find at your competitors.

Reviews.Title: Battery lasts long and easy to recharge
Reviews.Author: mi_v "`"
Reviews.Content: Compared to the older model I owned which needed AA batteries, this is beyond comparison!  I am very happy to own it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, lots of features, powerful zoom, easy to use and lightweight!  Exactly what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: W. Morgan
Reviews.Content: The only drawback is that you do not get printed instructions that you can take with you when you are learning to use it.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Pink_Elephant_Circus
Reviews.Content: I am an art teacher but I have very limited background with photography, so I did some research to find a reasonably priced camera that was better than your average point and shoot but simpler than the professional DSLRs. This camera has been perfect for me. I am still exploring the settings and options but it is pretty user friendly and the pictures have all been coming out great.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Donald A. Medine
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes great pictures at all distances and light situations. I tried another brand of camera before and returned it. I will keep this one for many years.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Earl Carpenter
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I have had over a year and no problems. the camera has been updated to an SX50 HS and it great for all around use or as a back up camera.

Reviews.Title: VERY IMPRESSIVE SMALL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Bill McLean "Is this worth the price?"
Reviews.Content: The SX40 takes sharp images, works beautifully in most photo environments, even when on the fully automatic setting.  And it has so many simple to use adjustments that it can make an amateur's photographs look like the work of professionals.  It's really a modern miracle.A modern miracle, yes, but not perfect:(1) It doesn't have a hot shoe.  This means no auxiliary flash for more lighting power or bounce flash lighting effects.  In this price range I think it should have a hot shoe.  The SX20 does.(2) The zoom control is in the same spot as the shutter release.  This makes it almost impossible to get really good close-up fast action shots.  (With my Canon Rebels I zoom the lens constantly with my left hand as I press the shutter release with my right hand). Then, with the setting on "Sports," and  the shutter set on rapid bursts, I can often get great shots at the local dog park.  But those dogs do move  fast.  The SX40 simply takes more skill to work this fast.  When it comes to speed a younger person can always do better than me.(3) While my SX20 came with a nice lens shade, the SX40 does not.  (Is Canon trying to cut costs?)(4) The SX40, like the SX20, does not record photographs in RAW format - only JPEG.  This is an amateur point and shoot camera.  Most of these types can't shoot RAW, but some in this price range do.  But most stores that make prints can only use JPRG as RAW formats need to be edited on a computer.(5) Also, like the SX20, a special adapter must be purchased in order to use an Ultraviolet, Polarizer, or other filters.NOTE: Excellent accessories, like spare batteries, lens hood, adapters, etc., can always be found at a fraction of the Canon price.The Canon SX40 is a great amateur camera with some aspects that could be useful to professionals.  Any professional lens that extends to this length and when fully extended has a maximum aperture of f5.6, would weigh a ton and cost a fortune.  The new SX50 telephoto zoom is even greater than the SX40, but right now it cost $400.00 on Amazon.  Actually, I don't think I would want it.  Enough is enough.With my Canon Pro9000 printer I have made good prints up to 16X20" with the SX40.  And I can radically crop (trim) pictures to change the format as desired.  I can do this with confidence with the SX40 set on ISO100 - 800.  Higher ISO settings start to show some electronic noise.Improvements of the SX40 over the SX20 include (1) substituting powerful rechargeable lithium batteries with charger, thus replacing AA alkaline batteries in the SX20; (2) focal length up to 35X instead of 20X and; (3) a newer in-camera processor that increases the number of shots per second in each burst.  I should also mention that night shooting is handled in a very novel way with the SX40.  I won't get into it at this time.  As I use the camera more I'll probably find more improvements, but I think these are the most important.Would I recommend the SX40 to my friends?  You bet I would.  It is easy to use, makes great pictures, is light weight, and incredibly versatile.If you are contemplating the purchase of the SX40 you can first download the User Guide from the Canon USA website.  Then, if you decide to buy one, you might learn how to use the camera  before it arrives.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Verma S. Walker
Reviews.Content: This camera has rekindled my love of photography.  Until now I have preferred compact travel zooms because of the convenient size but my last one gave disappointing results, so after reading all the glowing reviews I decided to splurge on an SX 40.  It is certainly a lot bigger than I'm use to but the results really make it worthwhile. The pictures are so crisp and sharp.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, compact and works like high end SLR
Reviews.Author: Durrell fan "Camera Nut"
Reviews.Content: Excellent photos that look like they were taken with a DSLR. Excellent image stabilization. All in a compact, easy to carry size.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: terranova
Reviews.Content: bought this to replace my Kodak 850 camera. i really like this camera and love the zoom lens. takes great pics and video and brings everything up clase

Reviews.Title: Super easy to use
Reviews.Author: K. Evans "Aunt Kelly"
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX40 is super easy to use. If you don't know anything about white balance and f-stops and the like you can use the "P" setting and let the camera make all those decisions for you. If you DO know something about photography, you can choose all the settings for yourself. 35X optical zoom is amazing, but you'd better have a very steady hand or use a tripod. And take the time to read the instructions if you want to get the most out of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great picture taking camera.
Reviews.Author: Monica R. Hoeber
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures indoors and out. Great zoom and many options to use the get the right shot.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: For me I'm not profissonal'm very happy and because this camera is unsurpassed in its class, for those who are still in doubt, the hint is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: The camera does a great job.Has a lot of  features to take great pictures.I like the feature for night pictures.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary Bowen
Reviews.Content: I have a bit of experience with various cameras, and as far as "advanced point-and-shoot" cameras go, this is exceptional. I previously owned an Olympus SP-565 UZ, and that worked pretty well for me but the Canon SX40 is even better. The quality is superb- even when the photos are taken far away with the zoom.I notice a lot of reviews go extremely in-depth and some will give the camera 3 stars because "the aperture control isn't as ideal as this other camera, etc.", but the Canon SX40 is really great in many areas, and I have yet to find anything remotely disappointing. It's a great camera overall.I would recommend this if you have some experience with cameras, just because you'll have more fun playing around with settings. The automatic settings are great as well as the manual settings. It's basically a baby DSLR. You really can go crazy and do nearly anything with this camera.It has a swing-out screen which is a bonus, and a nice lens cap and strap are included.I just received it so I don't know the in and outs of this camera 100%, but I can't wait to use it more!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS - Really good camera
Reviews.Author: Jenny Reichley
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because Consumer Reports rated this camera as an excellent camera for photos and videos. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Gary Chilcote
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived quickly and it is exactly as described.  It takes great pictures and has performed flawlessly.  I would recommend this camera for anyone desiring an easy to use digital camera with lots of more advanced features.

Reviews.Title: Great All in One Package!
Reviews.Author: L. Smith
Reviews.Content: A must have for outdoor sporting events. 8 shot burst is really cool, and 1080p movie recording with the flip out screen works awesome with a handle. Better indoor shots than SX50 (.7 stops). Tons of modes for "idiot proof" photography for those like myself (fireworks, low light hand held, snow, etc.). Really all you need for great shots and a third of the price of a DSLR with couple of lenses.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing
Reviews.Author: James T. Rook "Turtleman"
Reviews.Content: I have a computerized telescope I never use any more .... I took pictures of the full moon, and at the edge you could see individual mountains and ranges.There are supposedly better cameras with better specs .... and being aware of that, I bought this one ......Why?Canon CHDK !It adds a thousand dollars of features to THIS camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Katherine A.
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy and satisfied with my purchase.  The camera was a great price and takes excellent pictures, even in low light.

Reviews.Title: Not my 1st and certainly not my last Canon
Reviews.Author: gumby
Reviews.Content: I've owned Canon cameras since the 1960s.  I have never been disappointed with any of them.  This camera surprised me with the high quality image at maximum zoom.  I had expected noticeable graininess.  There is some but you have to look especially close to notice.

Reviews.Title: awsome pictures
Reviews.Author: maine yankee
Reviews.Content: this camera keeps blowing my mind. Im a truck driver and was lucky enough to see an american Bald eagle and get pitcure that ive wouldnt of even tried to with my old camera crystal clear. Even one with him closing his mebrane on his eye. I just wish i could show that pics to you.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40
Reviews.Author: Monkey2011
Reviews.Content: I revived the camera in very good conditions it was well packaged as well. I am extremely satisfied with the product!

Reviews.Title: For a point and shoot camera under $400.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tracer76"
Reviews.Content: Its a Canon for one. I did check it out before I bought the camera over at BB. I did like the feel and its not too heavy at all. I found a hack for the cameras firmware so I can now shoot RAW as well. Without the hacked firmware loaded I was able to zoom in to the moon and see craters on the moon and was able to take some very nice shots of it as well. For night shots it does great for a non DSLR style camera. I am still learning more about it as well. I really have not tried the video yet for 720 or even 1080 at all, so I cannot comment on how well it is or is not. Going from a old A590IS Canon to this was a large difference for a point and shoot.In the manual it states that you can take off the top of the camera called a hot shoe and place another flash there, I still have not figured it out and cannot get it off.

Reviews.Title: Amazing image stailization and zoom!
Reviews.Author: Lodestar "Jer"
Reviews.Content: I would have never thought that you could hand hold and snap with this kind of zoom range. I started with a tripod sure the image stabilization wasn't worth much, but when I went to illustrate that point to somebody else, I played the fool as it stabilized at full digital zoom (which puts my binoculars to crying shame).If you're a birder looking at this camera it is phenomenal for species ID. I had a flock of very small quick Turnstones taunting me for weeks. I was completely unable to get them, even through binoculars, though staking them out several times. I set the camera up for 12fps+ burst mode and waited with the zoom out and focus set. They came and I was able to get some shots of them very distant that enabled me to id them. The same is true for whales like the Orcas that came through last week.It might not have the sharpest low light high zoom capabilities (not the fastest glass around), but for the price it blows everything else out of the water.Lots of cool creative features as well like single color black and white where you choose a color from the scene you're shooting and it makes everything else B&W.; I'm sure you could do most all of it in post processing, but with this camera you don't have to.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter-in-law for her birthday. She loves it because it is so easy to use and takes Great pictures!Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price!
Reviews.Author: D. Godwin "Sheltie Lover"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a better camera but didn't want to spend $1,000 or more for one.  This camera is perfect!  The pictures are gorgeous and it's easy to use.  I love it so much I convinced my best friend to get one too.  Canon always comes through and with this camera, they've outdone themselves!

Reviews.Title: Fills my needs
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: As might be expected I am still in the learning curve with this camera, and what it is capable of. Some things I've had trouble understanding, such as when I first tried it for several days, I'd turn on the camera only to get the message, "lens problem, camera will now shut down." It literally froze and the only way I could get it to work is to remove the memory card and immediately re-insert it. After several days, it simply stopped doing it and I still don't know the origin of the problem. The other side of the coin is that I am learning more and more about it and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camera
Reviews.Author: Manuel Patino
Reviews.Content: I just received my camera, and it's amazing. The manual is very easy to understand, so if you follow the instructions you can start to take all the advantages of the camera. After reading many reviews online about this camera I didn't have doubt that this is perfect for taking great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera! Fun use w/ lots of manual control.
Reviews.Author: BRKLYN
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something in between my little P&S; camera and my DSLR. I wanted something with more power & zoom than the P&S; but a lot lighter and more versatile than my heavy DSLR w/ lenses. This camera met almost all my needs. I've had it for about 2 weeks so I still have a lot of things to test but so far, it has been excellent. easy enough to carry every day, everywhere but also provides near DSLR quality & control. It's not a replacement for my DSLR as I can still see the difference but it's a nice alternative for me when I don't want to carry it around.The zoom is amazing. I used it as a baseball game sitting in left field 400 level seats and I could get shots into the dugout that were pretty clear. Action shots are a bit tough if you are zoomed in far but work well at closer range. If you have a tripod or can steady your shot, it will help when zoomed in. Video quality is good though I haven't done much with it. I really like the swivel LCD. I can get low, high & angled shots much easier now.A few things I didn't like. Maybe it's because I come from a DSLR, the camera felt so tiny in my hands. It's shaped like a mini DSLR with the hand grip but smaller so it was a bit awkward at first but you get used to it. Some of the menu option & controls aren't as intuitive as my other canon. Again, maybe because I've been so used to DSLRs. I couldn't figure out how to switch from view finder to LCD. But I also really like that you can switch between these two options. But using the view finder is a bit awkward since the camera is small.I'll come back and do a better review once I've had a chance to play with it more but so far, I am really loving it.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40
Reviews.Author: geoff
Reviews.Content: Have taken about 100 pics and 2 movies indoor and outdoors of grandkids, wildlife, action and stills, completely satisfied with clarity and detail.  Easy to use, directions simple, battery life no problems,zoom works well, great camera.  Delivery was on time, great service, purchased power kit with additional batteries, charger, etc, have not used but was good value.  Thanks to the camera gurus with the detailed reviews for guidance in the purchase of this camera really helped.

Reviews.Title: wow. what a great cam for a such good price
Reviews.Author: Olena
Reviews.Content: very good camera. i was gonna get canon sx30is but they were so expensive comparing to this one. so i decided to go with canon sx40. now i'm glad i did the right choice. really happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS from Amazon.
Reviews.Author: Rickmc325
Reviews.Content: I have waited for a good while for this camera. My last PowerShot was the SX10IS. I took a lot of pictures with the 10 and was quite happy with it. I didnt see much improvement in the model 20 or 30 so I waited. What I was looking for was better video and the 40 has HD video.The 40 uses 67mm filters and if you use filters you will have to buy a lens hood that screws to the filters. Unlike the earlier models, the 40 does not come with a lens hood and I assume it's because of that.As with the previous versions of this camera, Canon had not yet decided to give this model PowerShot RAW capability. Maybe someday. But I will use the 40 till they decide to add RAW. Then I'll probably upgrade again.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Pebbs
Reviews.Content: This is the camera I have been looking for.  Wish I had purchased one like this a long time ago.  More features than I can learn at the moment. I was trying to decide between this one and a competitor.  Took me 2 weeks to decide, then when I did decide it took me another hour and a half to make sure.  Will not be sorry I spent the money.  Thank you Canon, you are the best.

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Curley
Reviews.Content: After years using 35mm format cameras, I finaly tried digital several years ago. They stunk! Slow, power hungry! Over the years, the technology got better. I like the Canon Powershots and the Nikon Coolpix cameras, but I needed more. They were ok for pocket cameras. I tried a Nikon Coolpix 8700 in 2006. Great camera, then, nice camera now. But like all electronics, the Nikon was out of date. You also have to remember these are computers with lenses. The Nikon Coolpix 8700 sold for $999 in 2004, $130 now. That's why I kept my budget under $400. I wanted lots of zoom, low light, fast focus, and not too complicated. The Canon SX40 HS was excellent in most catagories. With a 35x optical zoom, you can catch those close ups and image stability keeps them in focus. The 12MP also helps here. HD movies can be taken by pushing the convenient red button on the back. Flash on off is simple, flip up the flash, it's on, down it's off. I like that it also has a hot shoe on top for add on flash. It has a Li-on battery, which I have always had a good experience with on past Canons. Charge time is under 2 hours and it takes a huge number of pictures. You can always buy a spare if you are worried. I liked the rotating/flip LCD. Turned around it's protected. SO far the only cons are it seems slightly over-exposed when using the flash (easily corrected in Photoshop) and the lens cap design seems strange, the buttons are recessed. There are some special shooting settings and manual mode if you want to get creative. Canon makes the SX50 HS, which features 50x zoom and WiFi, for more money. Don't go too far on those zooms, they show more camera shake the farther you zoom and apperature gets a little extreme, all of which translate into fuzy pictures. The SX40 is getting harder to find, (the SX50 replaced it) but that can get you a better deal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Swati
Reviews.Content: My decission to buy camera was between basic SLR or High zoom camera. After alanysing both decided to go for High zoom camera. As this will fulfill my need as normal user for family outings. SLR definitely have good picture quality but in order to reap benefit i need to spend lot on lenses. so Decided to go for High zoom digital camera. After comparing Nikon, Panasonic, Sony and This Canon model. Made my mind for this camera. I am very satisfied with quality, performance and zoom. I will rate this 9/10.Few things i donot like in this camera are panaromic view, less stable zooming and night mode.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect-good for advanced hobbyists
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I debated between this camera and another one that costs almost twice as much. I finally settled on this one and I'm glad I did. Focus is rapid and smooth and the pictures are tack sharp. The articulating screen is very useful. All the basic settings are easy to find and easy to use. The sensor handles difficult lighting easily.The size is good, it cradles in the hand nicely and balances well, even at extreme zoom settings. The readout on the screen is easy to see and intuitive to use.What would make this camera perfect is including a printed manual. I know it saves paper and costs to not print one, but perhaps Canon could offer to send you one if you register the product. Or somebody could publish one as a third market item. You only need it for advanced settings but honestly, the PDF instructions are a nuisance to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 10 stars
Reviews.Author: Tedi-bear
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera to take pictures of my son's wedding on Waikiki.  I LOVE it.  It has awesome zoom, though you have to keep your hand steady while you zoom in on your subject. I have never been so happy about a camera before.  The picture quality is great.  The zoom is excellent.  The camera is very easy to use.  I would highly recommend getting this one.

Reviews.Title: Great investment
Reviews.Author: Bartlaw
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for someone who wants to bridge the gap between autmotic digital and SLR.  Can be as easy or hard to use as you want.  I read all the technial descriptions and criticisms but if you are looking at this camera then the technical stuff is not that important. Good photos that are heads above the camera phone or little digital, great zoom, ease of use - soooo happy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS.. Great Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Harris
Reviews.Content: I Love this camera. I have been waiting a couple years for Canon to get it to this point. Now it is ready. Everything works Great. Great low light pictures, the Auto Focus works Great. The Movies come out Awesome. Great sound too. Fast recycle time. I have No Complaints. I Really Like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Emoya
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that I am no camera techie, I am just someone who was looking for a step up from the point and shoot category, and this camera got good reviews from almost everyone. And I can't disagree, this is a fun camera that takes very nice pictures. If you are looking for a bridge camera, or if you're looking for a slight steup up this camera might be for you. If you are looking to use photography as a hobby, then maybe a low end DSLR camera might be a better option.The pros: the ease of use, for someone unfamiliar with DSLR this camera is great and affordable. The zoom is awesome and fun. There will be some pros out there that will tell you that the zoom is good but that it does not compare with zoom lenses from DSLR's. This is comparing apples to oranges, a DSLR camera is superior in every way, but the price is waaaayyyy superios as well.The cons: doesn't do great in low lighting, and the shutter speed is dissapointing. I read the Panasonic lumix has better shutter speed, so, if you're primary use for the camera is action or sports, than another camera might be better suited for you.Overall, I am very happy with the camera, outdoor pictures and pictures taken in good lighting look great. Again, the zoom in the camera is very fun to play with, and the stablization technology they have in the camera works very well. I recommend this camera for anyone who wants a step up from the point and shoot cameras while still maintaining the simplicity of use from that category.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40hs "Best Camera in the World"
Reviews.Author: ceeamerica
Reviews.Content: Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD I bought the Canon SX30 IS a year and I loved it. I have been studying reviews of the Canon SX40hs and the Nikon P510 for many months now and decided hands down to get the Canon SX40 for the following reasons: A) The Canon SX40 takes excellent pictures and video not only through-out it's 35X Optical range but very good quality in it's digital range giving it a full 140X Zoom range. This is much further than any other brand and because they beefed up the processor, image stabilizers and lowered the mega-pixels so the cmos could do a better job. B) DIGIC 5 is the most powerful processor and the same one used in Canon's most expensive DSLR cameras costing thousands of dollars. It has made a major improvement on low-light and stabilizing. C) Nikon P500 & P510 will not stay in focus at the 42X little own trying to use the 2X digital zoom (Don't take my word, look at the video tests on Youtube there are many of them and the problems show up in all of them.)

Reviews.Title: Cool features and nice photos, but not the camera for me
Reviews.Author: ARH
Reviews.Content: I have been using a Canon SX40 HS to do a number of photo jobs lately, plus I've been generally playing around with it.  It's been fun.  I've done distance zoom photos as well as close-up work.FYI - Most of my photographic life (30+ years) has been spent with either fully manual or auto/manual focus 35mm film cameras.  That ended a few years back, and the digital cameras we have owned since have been mainly point-and-shoot affairs.  I've been missing the flexibility of a camera with a wider range of options, so lately I've been exploring the world of dSLR cameras.This is my first real experiment with a dSLR, and there are some things that I really like, and some things I find annoying.Likes:1) The camera is quite light, so hauling it around would not be that tough, especially if you have a small soft camera bag with a shoulder strap.2) The camera has a wide range of capabilities, and the 12.1 megapixels of this unit generate stunning images.  E.g., the first day I had it I was looking out my office window, across a parking lot to a sidewalk about 200 yds away.  I went to maximum zoom and shot pix of people walking along.  When I uploaded the photos to my iMac and gave them a look I was struck by shock and awe with the clarity of the photos.  I could actually see the expressions on people's faces.3) Digital zoom is good.4) Image stabilization is excellent.5) I HAVE to have more than just a digital screen on any camera I own - I need a viewfinder.  I REALLY like the fact that I can switch between viewing options.6) The swivel on the digital screen allows it to be closed and protected.Dislikes:1) Aftern spending most of my life with cameras like the Pentax K1000 and the Canon AE1, this camera body/construction feels, um, plastic-y, and, frankly, cheap.2) While the camera body does have a somewhat ergonomic design, it does not feel comfortable in my hand.  This would be particularly true if you have large hands.  My hands aren't all that big, but I do have long fingers.3) There is a spot on the back of the camera with some dimples indicating that is where your thumb is supposed to go, but I don't personally prefer to have my thumb in that position when I hold the camera, so again, it's not as comfortable in my hand as I'd like.4) The thumb spot is flanked by three buttons to the right, a function wheel below, and the video record button to the left.  In just the few days I've been playing around with this camera I've accidentally hit some of those buttons several times...kind of annoying.5) I prefer to keep a good solid grip on my camera whenever I'm using it, especially while shooting - probably a holdover from years of NOT having stabilization in my cameras :-), but the problem is that kept getting blurry photos that I KNEW were within the camera's focal capability.  It wasn't until that happened a number of times that I noticed a light shining on the inside of my left hand.  It was covering an electric eye on the front of the camera, on left side of the viewfinder.  I was inadvertently blocking the electric eye so the camera couldn't focus correctly.  Argh!  This means that you have to either rest the camera on your left hand or grip the left side of the camera below that eye...other options won't work.6) One last thing...if you have the digital screen flipped outward, but you opt to use the viewfinder your nose will leave a grease spot on the digital screen.  That is just not appealing, but I guess, um, where else are you going to put it? (your nose and the screen :-)I readily admit that I have not played with all the options, mainly because I discovered enough things about this camera's shape and action to know that it's not for me.  I also have not had it long enough to comment on battery life and related issues - sort of wish it wasn't just a rechargeable battery, but I understand why they did that.Don't get me wrong, this a great little camera, but if I'm going to spend hundreds of dollars I'd rather end up with a camera that I don't have to make as many adjustments as this one would require.Could I get used to this camera?  Yes.Does it do a good job?  Yes.Do I like it?  Yes.Do I love it?  No.Am I choosing this camera?  No, but it might be just the camera for you!  I hope my comments were helpful.4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 - a very disapointing camera
Reviews.Author: Jon J. Sanserino
Reviews.Content: I really wish I had not bought this camera, but I needed one, and the price was really good.I LOVE Canon products. I have had several of their point and shoots and recently the S90 and S95 - little marvels that I take traveling around the world with great results. I also have a Canon printer and a Canon scanner - love 'em.  I wanted a camera more for local shooting, family parties, doing head shots,  etc. without the expense of a good DSLR and wide range zoom, and after exhaustive comparisons I chose the Canon when it was on a super sale. I already know how to use all the menus and hey - it's a CANON!!!  How could I go wrong?The colors and exposures are fantastic.  So why don't I like it?1. LENS. The zoom is ridiculous! the wide end is great, but IMO no one can use an 800mm zoom - 1600 mm with digital zoom!! Stupidly ridiculous - the same for other makers that are doing this.  It is impossible to hand-hold this even with six kinds of image stabilization, and if you are that serious about tripod mounted bird shots, etc, you should have a better camera.  I would GREATLY prefer a much smaller zoom range - say 300 mm and have the money and effort put into a faster f-stop that is maintained while zooming.  The SX-40 f-stop closes down so fast, that even at 100-120 mm for shooting portraits it is already too small to blur out the background. Stop playing the numbers game, Canon!Further - the lens is some special Canon only thread so you need an expensive adapter to be able to use standard filters, and then they are a larger and more expensive size. Thanks, Canon.2. ERGONOMICS - The camera is nice to hold, but when you put your thumb in the nice thumbgrip recess, there are 2 buttons right under your finger that you will always be pressing by accident.  I could not understand why the camera was doing weird things, and then I realized it was the button under my thumb while holding or picking up the camera. They could have been easily placed above the finger grip and should have been.All this I could still accept - especially for the price, except for:3. FOCUSING - No matter how I try, the pictures from this camera are consistently SOFT. Either it is just not focusing properly, or just not capable of a really sharp picture. I have been a pro and semi-pro for more than 40 years - I know how to hold a camera and squeeze off a shot. I could hand-hold my old Nikons for an acceptable  1/8 second exposure, but no matter how I try, the SX-40's photos are just never sharp - at least not to my eye.  I recently shot the same scenes with the Canon and my friend's cheapie Kodak and his photos were much more crisp when viewed on my computer screen.  I was in Seattle and shot the infamous gum wall about 100 times and literally NONE of the photos are crisp. I was 4 feet way in daylight - they should have been razor-sharp but weren't - just off a little.Unfortunately, by the time I have had it long enough to test it well, it is now too long to return it. However, once I find something to replace it with, it will go up for sale.  I am so disappointed in Canon for this!

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Old Georgia Geek
Reviews.Content: I have been using Canon digital cameras since 2005, after many years of using Pentax SLRs. My hands are small, I am left-handed, and as one reviewer said somewhere, there is a great "Canony" feel and user-friendliness to them. I also NEED an optical viewfinder, which many other manufacturers did not include with their digital point and shoots, because most of my personal photography is outdoor. (Hopefully in the sun.) I still keep my little SD 1000 in my purse at all times, just in case!Anyway - at the end of 2010, Canon also had dropped its optical viewfinders on all but it's higher end cameras. So, with promises of an easy to read display, and a good bridge-type of zoom, I tried an SX 130. Good camera, but I really missed my optical viewfinder. Also had purchased a Panasonic high-def camcorder that did not have an optical viewfinder. After almost 2 years of giving these a fair chance, I got an email from Amazon about the SX40 HS, and started researching and dreaming about it.Finally bought from Amazon in February, 2012. I have used it on trips and on local birds and more. It is my favorite camera since my old A95, and of course I like the SX 40 HS even better due to the optical zoom capability. Amazing night and low light photography! Excellent high def video that is beautiful on a high def TV. I know that some people have complained that it only uses .jpeg files, and long-term I may miss this. However, I have found that I've used the .jpeg for about 95% of my digital photo needs over the past few years, and haven't needed anything else since I retired. Thank you Amazon and Canon for my perfect camera

Reviews.Title: J. Rosell
Reviews.Author: A. Rosell
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good camera to take on an upcoming vacation.  Our son told us about the Cannon SX40.  We love it.  Very easy to use.  Excellent picture quality. Has some great features. Zoom is incredible.  Great stabilization, even at maximum zoom. We highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful camera!
Reviews.Author: kare777
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this new Canon and it is everything that I expected and more, except for one problem which I am wondering if might be just a defect in this one camera. Will get to that in a minute. I am a long-time user of the Canon mega zooms and this sx40 is replacing my sx10is which I have been completely satisfied with, and still am. The longer zoom range on the new sx40 pushed me to the upgrade, otherwise I would not be replacing my older model Canon. There are some differences between these models, some good and some not so much. I think the viewfinder was bigger and brighter on the sx10, and that does matter to me as I use the VF exclusively when shooting. The new model is also noticeably lighter, probably because of the battery difference, a good thing for one who spends many hours out in the field. The other reviewers have covered the differences, pros and cons, very thoroughly so I won't go into any more of that here.The problem that I'm having with this camera is a sort of grinding or chugging sound of an internal motor when aiming the camera or moving between subjects/lighting. I think it might be the auto exposure adjustment. I do not have the camera set for continuous autofocus or continuous image stabilization, so I don't think that's the issue. The sound is not real loud, but it is very noticeable and quite annoying. My sx10 makes a slight (similar, but quieter) noise when the auto focus is working its magic, but that is brief and it only occurs when I engage AF when ready to shoot. The sx40 seems to do this almost constantly while the lens cap is off, and not just while shooting. Is this normal for this camera? I am just about to start the return process because the constant sound is that annoying to me. I've read all through the manual, that eye-frying CD pdf thing on the computer screen, and so far have not found if there is a way to make this stop. If this is typical of all of the sx40s, then it is something to be aware of. For me, I'd have shopped for a quieter model or even a different brand if necessary. I realize that all of the digital cameras including DSLRs make some mechanical sounds, but this seems like too much and too constant. There was never any issue with the sx10 at all.Might increase the rating as this problem resolves, because this camera otherwise deserves more than three stars.Update: Jan. 1, 2012:Thanks so much to the Amazon community for the comments and feedback on their own sx40s! I now know that others do not have this issue, so this particular camera is probably defective. I have revised my rating to four stars. I would easily give this camera five stars without any hesitation....except for that small viewfinder! It is a step down from the bigger, brighter viewfinder on the previous models, so minus one star.

Reviews.Title: OMG Best camera I've used in years!
Reviews.Author: Kathy S "Kathy Sacksteder"
Reviews.Content: And the best digital camera I've ever used! Virtually fool proof focus and guidance is provided on screen, so it's difficult to get a bad picture if you follow it's hints. I use mine to get pics of my animals in my house, I have several friends with this camera who highly recommended it who use it to photograph wildlife while they're on hikes in the woods, parks, and at the beach. It's easy to get professional quality photos on the first try - I was getting exceptional quality pics in a couple sessions just by playing around with the settings and seeing what I could get. I HIGHLY recommend this camera to all of my friends who have any interest in both serious photography and just catching quick shots of the family.

Reviews.Title: Works prettry well
Reviews.Author: L. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I carefully studied about 40 cameras over several months and this one seemed to be the best value overall. I considered DSLR's but in the end did not want the learning curve or expense or dealing with multiple lenses. The zoom on this camera is amazing and that was an important consideration for me. The camera does a pretty good job of focusing the picture even with my jiggling hands. A tripod would probably resolve that.The only things I do not like about this camera are the power and zoom buttons. Either I power it on and the lens does not come out or I power it off and the lens does not retract. I change the zoom and the lens either does nothing or does the opposite of what I wanted it to do or it initially zooms/unzooms as I wanted it but then it returns to its original setting. But these are relatively minor nuisances more than anything.I will say that i have gotten many incredible landscape shots with this camera. Postcard type shots worthy of showing off to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, not quite a DSLR but makes up for it!
Reviews.Author: Zbaker1398
Reviews.Content: Overall a great camera I have been playing around with it for awhile now and am very impressed!Pros:1) Image quality is truly amazing2) Excellent low light, day light3) Fantastic zoom and an amazing image stabilizer4) 1080p Video is amazing5) Lots of features and versatility6) ZOOM! Seriously it's greatCons:1) Motor noise is especially noticeable in quiet environments2) There is no external microphone jack3) Zooming while taking video is very loud!

Reviews.Title: Say hello to a good buy
Reviews.Author: YardE-Buyer
Reviews.Content: This was worth the money. I paid about $375 for this in June (2012)and I must say I was not disappointed.I am not a yet a pro photographer and frankly I know very little about cameras when I bought this. It was recommended by a firend (who know about camera's) and I liked the reviews.Now, I must say I am better informed and into photography and so far I am not disappointed at having bought this one. It has great zoom and amazing quality. I took it to the Olympics and good some great shots at the Stadium. It is great for taking to sport events where you may need to zoom in to get good shots.The video feature is fantastic at least for what I want it to do and the quality is great.It is not too bulky thought and the batter life doesnt suck.It comes loaded with soo much features its unbelieveable. For example:1> It allows you to switch colours of objects when taking pictures2> The slow motions and super slow motion video recording3> You can take black and white pictures but particular shade in colour.Most of this you can do on photoshop, but if the camera can do it then who needs the extra work right?Cons:The zoom is a bit noising during recording. However, nothing I cant get over. For me its not a deal breaker.To take panorami pic you will need to stich them on your computer which is not something I liked.Other than that I would say, if you just getting into photography seriously, then this is really a great starter....I was happy  I got it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent but with a few flaws...minor though
Reviews.Author: Roberto Vicente "bodhiu"
Reviews.Content: An excellent camera but not quite a DSLR yet (perhaps in another 2-3 generations), but the all in one bridge cameras are vastly improved.Weakenesses were the weak AWB, macro not all that great, does take stitch shots but doesn't edit in camera, and no RAW (the most disappointing of all). Camera does struggle in dimmer light situations. Nosie levels are excellent.  First big outing with the SX40.  To its credit, most of these shots would have been impossible without it's super 800mm lens and excellent image quality with the new Canon processor.  An excellent camera but not quite a DSLR yet (perhaps in another 2-3 generations), but the all in one bridge cameras are vastly improved.Weakenesses were the weak AWB, macro not all that great, does take stitch shots but doesn't edit in camera, and no RAW (the most disappointing of all).  Camera does struggle in dimmer light situations.  Nosie levels are excellent.  Battery durability was good with over 450 shots taken, but I also turn the camera off between every shots.But the potent zoom and Canon excellent image quality make up for the rest. I'd give the camera a 4 out of 5.  Check out my uploaded images taken at San Diego Zoo for image quality.

Reviews.Title: The best bridge camera for me.
Reviews.Author: Frank L. Sweeney
Reviews.Content: The SX40 is comfortable and easy to handle and carry........I have reached a point in life when everything should be as easy as possible and that is what Canon delivers: A great focal length, an adjustable viewfinder and a decent price.  No bulky lenses and a heavy  and overloaded camera bag..........the SX40 makes my amateur efforts look better. Amazon made my purchase easy with concise reviews and specs.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: This is a really  great camera. I really love the 35x zoom, I have been taking a lot of pictures of birds and am getting some really good shots. This camera has a lot of custom settings and will take some time to learn how to use them. I have had some problems getting the camera to focus on a bird at the 35x zoom but I am sure that I just need to learn more about this camera. I am not crazy about the auto setting as the camera keeps changing settings while you are taking a picture. I know that it is finding the best setting for the conditions but I just do not like all the changes (just another learning issue).I would buy this camera again I really do like it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: marginwpb
Reviews.Content: I'm a longtime user of Canon cameras and this one with it long lens and BSI CMOS sensor does a superior job on low light pictures.  Well worth the investment.  The seller is great, camera was shipped on time and arrived is perfect condition.  You can't go wrong with this seller.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Indeed
Reviews.Author: honestly:)
Reviews.Content: This camera does really rocks your world... it can do anything... however, I still see that If you can afford the Pana-FZ150 & don't really strive for the 35X zoom, go for the pana. BUT, this canon is just an amazing piece of tech... :)

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Heike Moers "Heike"
Reviews.Content: I almost did not buy the camera because of the few bad reviews. But there were so many good ones, that we decided to try it anyway, and we love it. I have even already taken a picture of the moon - freehand, and it turned out quite good. We could not find the ISO problems that the others reported. It is all working well for me.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal! (from a non-expert)
Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: I've purchased between 5 and 10 digital cameras over the years but have less and less time to use them as I get older so I have a much harder time comparing this camera with what is available today.This is also my most expensive camera yet so presumably I'd be happier with it than anything previous. None-the-less I've got say there are a few qualities of this camera at which I marvel. The zoom, of course, is one. Seeing the craters on the moon, or the pupils of the eyes of birds shot at great distance... those were impressive! The image stabilization was as well. For the moon pictures I was fully zoomed (all the way through the digital range) and had only propped my elbows on a support--I did not use a tripod--and the image was sharp! I found macro shots of flowers to be exceptional as well. At the same time I recognize that a pro may not have been nearly as impressed as me, so remember--these are the impressions of an amateur.I do admit that pictures taken when fully zoomed are just usable as shot. Further zooming on the pc does not yield more detail or a more appealing picture. And the sharpness of the detail does trail off when fully zoomed, but some camera-knowledgeable friends had warned me that this is typical when shooting at high zoom levels.I won't say that even most of my macros or zooms were sharp, either--a good number were a bit out of focus. But the fact that SOME of them were means that the camera is capable and the user needs more practice.The one feature that I was not crazy over is where the camera tries to guess what you want to focus on and puts a box around it on the screen. Too often it guessed incorrectly and I had to move the camera around until it would focus on my chosen subject.

Reviews.Title: Good Improvement-but-
Reviews.Author: warrant
Reviews.Content: Worth the price of upgrade from the SX30.  Except for the new software and the new sensor basically same camera as the SX 30.  Better pictures than before-still no RAW but that's available with a CHDK hack.  Now for the but.  No reason that this camera is slower that almost all of the other ultra zooms.  I can't believe that Canon isn't able to at least tie the others in this area.  No reason for not upgrading the viewfinder and LCD monitor, everyone else has. Still a great lens.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 purchase
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Moyer
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. Easy to use and takes great photos and switches to the movie mode in a flash. I used it at my husbands Military reunion and the movie I took at the memorial service is posted on You Tube: Check it out. Combat Control Memorial Push Up

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera for Camera Newbie
Reviews.Author: Casey "Husband, father, avid Disney lover, an...
Reviews.Content: This camera is AWESOME!  It came recommended by a friend and I haven't been happier.  My favorite function on this camera is the handheld night shot.  I have never been able to get good night shots until now!  :D  The pictures turn out beautiful and the camera is pretty simple to use.It did take a bit to find out how to do video, but once we did, the videos turn out great as well.  AWESOME BUY!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Smith
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and pretty easy to use.  I bought it because my friend has one and I love how far it will zoom without changing a lense.  Best camera I have ever used.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: George Kasunick
Reviews.Content: Living in SW Florida there are a lot of great places to take photos, this camera is just perfect, awesome point and shoot camera, the zoom is great and the price was the best I found,

Reviews.Title: Worth Ever Penny!
Reviews.Author: Desiree Derr
Reviews.Content: As an amateur photographer who admittedly doesn't know much, this is a fantastic camera that takes amazing pictures. The zoom is more than sufficient and the definition BLOWS my mind. We use this camera constantly...dare I say more than our smart phone.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the field when birding
Reviews.Author: C Bear "biker"
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of extra perks with this camera so download a manual to get the most out of it. It beats carrying a heavy DSLR around all day. I have my camera on a sling strap and hardly notice it's there. Quality of pictures is very good. If you're doing a photo with high zoom, a tripod would be a good idea for blur-free shots. You can hand hold the camera if you're steady but will probably get some less than desirable shots, especially in the wind. The camera powers up fast and has rapid continuous shooting except in RAW mode.  It  lacks a hot shoe.The LCD screen can be set at about any angle to help with difficult shots, a nice plus. Image Stabilization helps with those long shots. It is a useful camera that takes great photos at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Timothy D. Gibson
Reviews.Content: great

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Patricia Garza
Reviews.Content: I love my camera, it was a replacement for the same kind I had that got broken so, I knew exactly what I was getting, clear pics, video is awesome. zoom is very nice. couldn't ask for a better camera at a better price.

Reviews.Title: prety good
Reviews.Author: gusafro
Reviews.Content: good product woks very well and it have a good quality, good materials and good price i recommend it always

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Simone Cox
Reviews.Content: The camera has exceeded my expectations.  I don't take a lot of pictures, but when I do I want a camera that's versatile.  This camera fits that bill.  I love it!I go to a convention every year and that truly will be the test for this camera.  The conditions are always low light and the few test shots I've done have been good, but the true test will be at the convention.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40
Reviews.Author: Nika Menabde
Reviews.Content: Works very well, but the charger is broken.  I bay new charger, because it has not worked. Unfortunately I am not happy.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Garbati
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the product, it is what i was expecting, very good quality. I am grateful and waited keep buying new products
