Reviews.Title: Soooo happy! Worth the investment
Reviews.Author: Melanie Wass
Reviews.Content: Been looking for more than a point-and-shoot but won't spend the money on a true DSLR ... this is the perfect compromise, in my opinion. With several settings to use depending on your photo situation, this camera gets it right. I haven't even begun to figure it out completely but have been more than happy with the photos I have taken (in the snow; of kids playing baseball; inside portraits) ... Best camera purchase ever.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: SafeHaven
Reviews.Content: I chose this over the newer model based on reviews and lower cost.  It has plenty of Zoom, and also has digital zoom as well if needed.  It is small and light weight enough that I can put it into my fanny pack and transport it that way when I am not actively taking photos.  Picture quality seems to be great.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Jackie Ives
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for outdoors.  My indoor pictures leave something to be desired.  Maybe I haven't gottten the right setting yet.  I bought it to go to Africa and was not disappointed in the wildlife pictures I got.

Reviews.Title: A Near-Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Offer
Reviews.Content: I almost gave up on Canon when my expensive Canon G12 died after less than two years, but this camera had too many wonderful features to pass up. I took it on a trip to Hawaii, and it took wonderful pictures. I have owned several Canon cameras and thought Canon infallible until my ill-fated Canon G12, but this camera has renewed my faith in the quality of Canon cameras. I just hope it doesn't die an early death like the G12.I wish it had a connection for a remote, but otherwise it's very good.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX-40 HS
Reviews.Author: Ed Kreczmer
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX-40 HS 12.1 MP Digital camera with a 35x Wide angle optical image arrived in a timely fashion.  I am impressed with its ease of use, and I am presently using it in place of my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Kare Anderson
Reviews.Content: I really like my Canon SX 40 digital camera.  It takes great pictures and I can get great close ups.  I  am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Slow Trigger... Big  Barrel.
Reviews.Author: ECampos "Elvis"
Reviews.Content: I love this Camera. I don't write reviews unless I have owned an Item over six months or played with it enough times to get an idea of how it performs.I have owned the SX40 HS for over three years and Have to give it five stars be cause, within those three years I have learned more about Photography, and purchased a DSLR, yet i find my self using the SX40 more than I expected to.The Key reasons are:Micro - Mega without switching lens ( thats nice at the zoo or anywhere that you don't have time to go digging in a bag)Smaller than an DSLR- Not a pocket pocket camera, but easy to travel with.Battery is great! -  ( Unless you use the flash for all pictures.)

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: Love my camera. Very easy to use. and a great optic soom  Recommended to a friend and she got one as well

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Nicholson
Reviews.Content: Bought a used camera because I admired my friends. Easy to use and awesome pictures I made sure to request one made in Japan, not China.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff.
Reviews.Author: brandon jones
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great shots, not too heavy, and is pretty easy to use. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a camera that's a step up from a point and shoot, but not quite ready to get a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: this is how you do it
Reviews.Author: Melinda Kovacs
Reviews.Content: I have been so unlucky with cameras before, but with this one, I took no chances: I ordered the exact same model my photography-minded sister has. I love it! It does everything I was hoping it would do: sharp images, enough options, articulated LCD screen, powerful zoom and still does not weigh too too much. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great value for a  Canon camera that does it all
Reviews.Author: Harold A. Bouton
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Canon camera.  24mm to 800 + mm will take care of most photo opportunities. Good low light capabilities. Because the SX50HS has been released you can find a new SX40HS for a great price. I don't know how many people need a 1200mm telephoto. I don't.  Thats the lens on the SX50HS. I sold my DSLR Canon T3 and all my telephoto equipment. Just a hassle changing one lens for another and them missing the moment for a great shot. This is a great all around camera. You can't go wrong with this camera by your side.

Reviews.Title: I'm in Love!
Reviews.Author: Margaret Smith
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get home and try out my new Camera but of course like all batteries you must charge them first. So I charged my battery, and when I had enough power went out and took test shots of my Dogs. Truly an amazing camera! I really did get a good bang for my buck with this.I also run a website, so I'll be using it for videos, as well as go to Conventions as press. This will definitely come in handy.

Reviews.Title: Superb quality photos.
Reviews.Author: Aviator "History Buff"
Reviews.Content: My wife has the SX30 model and this is even better at a lower price!  Photos are sharp, battery lasts forever!!!!!!!  Only negative thing I have found is the location of the check zoom button which allows you to instantly zoom back to find your moving subject if it leaves your current zoom area.  With a little practice, I can keep from accidentally hitting it while lining up a shot.  Zoom is incredible and the stabilization works very well.  Hard to do better!

Reviews.Title: Love! Love! Love! this camera.
Reviews.Author: zoe80127
Reviews.Content: We bought this to take on our trip to Alaska.  We got videos of Holgate Glacier calving, sea lions sunning, sea otters floating, grizzlies foraging.  And Denali up close and personal.  It's our go-to camera for everything from birthdays to holidays and vacations.  I took it to NY and got amazing pictures of the Statue of Liberty from the bay, the city at night from the bay.....it's more than we'd hoped for.  I'd recommend this to anyone.  Actually, my husband is looking to get one for himself because he can't pry this one out of my hands.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: ernie
Reviews.Content: great camera, good still shots, the video's are wonderful, so clear like a pro. Also taking stills while shooting videos is a good asset  highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I think for the price this is the best deal on the market. It takes fantastic photos and as long as you read the user manual you won't have any problems with your photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: I saved up to get this and have just fallen in love with this camera.  It has many functions and people are always commenting on how great the 35X zoom is for getting those long distance shots.  Built well and I recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Fun - Fun - Fun
Reviews.Author: Haute Momma
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  There are a lot of functions and capabilities.  I need to read the book again to get more adept with the camera but you can literally start 'pointing and shooting'.  Great camera!  Always love Cannon products.

Reviews.Title: LOVE love love! our camera!
Reviews.Author: Amy Colton
Reviews.Content: We are still learning all of the features but we absolutely love our family camera and hope to continue to love it through the years!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Tech Support "Norm"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for its zoom capability (35x). I am from South Africa and often go back to do safaris in the National parks, got tired of getting small blurry shots that were out of range. This camera has amazing zoom, it takes amazing pics, I use it at Nascar races also and am extremely happy with it- does everything I needed and more. People have commented on my photo quality it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: A Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Glen49er
Reviews.Content: Very good images but too many options/adjustments for seldom users unless left on AUTO setting.  Really a good camera to like.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Dusty Track
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a present for my wife who is more advanced than a beginning photographer, but not at the professional photographer level. She loves this camera! The color and sharpness are very good and the telephoto is fantastic. Have had it for 3 months and have taken about 300 pictures with no problems. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: Nice Canon!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So far I like it. I'm not in love with it yet, but I don't feel as though I have explored it's full functionality. I tend to take a lot of blurred shots with this camera still. I need more practice. Over all I feel as though it's a good camera with lots of options and the video isn't bad! I will update as I actually learn to use it (I hope)!

Reviews.Title: A Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Nefarious Oldman
Reviews.Content: Wow, this has been an amazing camera for our family. We enjoy the ease of a point and shoot, so that is a plus, but we are also very impressed with the pictures.  I would consider this as a nice step up from a pocket sized point and shoot before moving up to the expensive SLR cameras.  It has a lot of nice features. We've been using in a couple of years now, so I am sure Canon has a newer model, but this one was excellent for us.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: tcurex
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to a much better camera by purchsing this camera and am so happy with the many features available.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Bakula
Reviews.Content: It takes great photos~ reasonable price. Enough options for varying photo shots. Light weight! My daughter loves it. Great delivery too!

Reviews.Title: Sweet..
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  I have only had it about a month and so far I really love it.  It has an awesome zoom and a lot of extra features such as vivid colors, the ability to crop, and many different scene modes.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Ronwald
Reviews.Content: I just love this one that i don't have to have a separate lens to attach it to.I'm in love with this device.Zoom in and zoom out.

Reviews.Title: Grat camera
Reviews.Author: Jim Messer
Reviews.Content: Great camera with loads of features...not being a guy who likes to read instruction manuals I watched the excellent tutorial on You Tube to get started...metering and picture quality is excellent..the only knock I have is cycle recovery time after shooting a picture w/o flash in low light conditions...it is a great back up camera for me and I take it everywhere with me....the digital zoom sucks but you can block it so you only stay in optical zoom...best pictures in the zoom mode come with the best lighting..I love this little camera

Reviews.Title: Canon--The way to go!!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for me. I am truly enjoying learning how to use it. The pictures I have taken are an improvement over my older, fixed lens camera. Easy to use and carry.

Reviews.Title: Camera for personal use. Skip if photography is a more serious hobby.
Reviews.Author: A. Roldan
Reviews.Content: I got it because for years I really wanted to learn photography. I would play around with it and it takes amazing photos, and it has so much zoom! I could finally take the moon photos I wanted to take since forever!Then I got a little more serious in my photography hobby and took a class at my university. We used analog cameras and now we are using digital. Based on my minimal experience with photography, I have to say this camera would be good for trips and events, but if you are considering a becoming a serious photographer, even if it is just for a hobby, look into cameras that take RAW images, because this camera does not have that option. The SX50 does take RAW images.But I am not disappointed with this camera. If you just want to take great photos for yourself, friends, and family, but not going to go through the process of editing them in photoshop, then this is a great camera to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great zoom
Reviews.Author: Mariel
Reviews.Content: I am still learning more and more about what all this camera can do.  Coming from manual 35 mm, film camera to our first digital; this was the one I researched and found most capable for what I wanted.  The zoom on this camera is excellent.  The size is perfect for those wanting more than just a small pocket camera.  Photo colors are sharply detailed for what I want.  Just getting back into photography and starting with family and scenery shots, I find it's much more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera-  zoom & photo quality!!!
Reviews.Author: DianaB
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a camera with a great zoom and photo quality. I am so glad I found this! I am not familiar with a lot of the manual options available on this camera but it takes amazing photos even in "Auto" mode! The scene setting menu is great too. The newer version Of this model has an "even skin tone" setting which would be nice but I can photo shop if need be. Overall, amazing zoom & photo quality, even in the auto mode!

Reviews.Title: Very good quality!
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Rodeghero
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty easy to use. There are many functions and this is my first time owning such a serious camera!  I feel that I am able to use it pretty efficiently without too much trouble.  The photo quality is very good. I would definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Professional quality at a good price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excellent zoom range, good optics, light,, good color balance, light. Especially like the flip-out viewer that can be rotated and positioned at different angles.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: amit
Reviews.Content: awesome camera. The clarity is not as good as a DSLR but its decent as far as a regular Digicam is concerned

Reviews.Title: Must have! Look no further!
Reviews.Author: Cindy Weems
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera, very easy to use and takes awesome pictures.  The telescopic lens work extremely well. Great product, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: biddy719
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!  I have always been a Canon lover and was looking for something that was point and click, but a little better than my current one.  I def found it in this! =D

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: We went with this camera since it was less expensive than others, but still nice.  We've been pretty happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Salem
Reviews.Content: I was dreaming to own this one, thanks to God that I found it here. I am now taking photos everywhere. I'm proud that I have this one.

Reviews.Title: We like this camera
Reviews.Author: By
Reviews.Content: We Are not super camer buffs. This camer does everything we need. The only complaint is the refresh speed after you take A picture. I've missed some good shots because the camera wasn't ready.

Reviews.Title: Canon, always and forever
Reviews.Author: Drakes21
Reviews.Content: I had the SX30 for two years before upgrading to this one. I loved the SX30, but I decided it was time for a new one (I took over 5000 pictures with the old one). This one lives up to the Canon reputation and I love it just as much as the last one. The zoom is amazing! I would recommend a monopod when you have it zoomed all the way in if you are shaky. The images come out clear and the burst shooting is a lot faster on this model as compared to the SX30. The battery life is pretty awesome too. I can go several hundred pictures without recharging.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Tiga
Reviews.Content: I compared against the Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR and found it gave far superior results. Its staggering how good the combination of focusing, image stabilization and jpeg processing is at long tele settings. I wish it had focus priority for releasing the shutter, that the foussing was even faster, and that the viewfinder had higher resolution and magnification. I would like a manual or left hand zoom button. For tele, the power zoom is the slowest thing in the otherwise quick start-up. Used mostly for wildlife, with some amazing hand-held results.

Reviews.Title: Very good excellent
Reviews.Author: Jose Porras
Reviews.Content: I happy to camera very good more of the thingh i recomend this product the mail is more rapid satifation

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything I need it to do. Took it on vacation and we took some great pictures with it. It may not have all the bells and whistles, but it does what I need it to. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sebastian J Iglesias
Reviews.Content: Great quality pictures with sensational colours. The super slow recording is really awesome. I am only an amateur, and for me it has everething I expected.

Reviews.Title: A Birder's Delight!
Reviews.Author: S. Dietrich
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be the exact camera I was looking for to zoom in on distant birds on a lake or in a tree. Not at all shabby with birds in flight, either, and I've gotten some stunning photos with it. Have recently been using it for music videos to post on YouTube of my husband and my performances, and it does a great job with these, too. And I know I haven't even begun to tap into its potential...!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Dustin Huddleston
Reviews.Content: My wife loves everything about this camera! We have not had any problems. The clarity and quality is amazing, in fact, it's better than most camcorders! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Canon digital camera
Reviews.Author: MAY
Reviews.Content: I love it, I recommend it. has many functions. the photos are great. It is easy to use, of course, you must read the manual. is better than it appears. Is a professional camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: E. Herndon
Reviews.Content: Although it is kind of complicated for me (I keep having to get the manual out) this camera takes great pictures.  I'm a Realtor and bought this camera because I needed wide angle to take indoor shots of small rooms.  Works great!

Reviews.Title: Great All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: Sandra Hertsgaard
Reviews.Content: Just started using the camera and still getting used to it. It takes great pictures and the zoom with image stabilization is impressive. Does most of what a Digital SLR would do without all the bulky lenses.

Reviews.Title: Sony camera
Reviews.Author: windsorsdad
Reviews.Content: I got this upon the recommendation of my brother-in-law. It is a fantastic camera. It takes great pictures in any lighting situation. It is extremely easy to use. I have not had time to explore.everything it can do.  I hope this will be the last camera I buy for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Hebert "artkat"
Reviews.Content: Love this.  Love the way it feels, the way it works and the pictures it produces.  I use it generally to take photos that I can paint from (I am an artist).  When the painting is completed, I need a decent photo to place on my website.  I've not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: good camera, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Vince
Reviews.Content: I was inticed to buy this camera due to the large optical zoom.  it was good features such as the large zoom, the HD video and the abilitiy to zoom while in video mode.  Takes good pictures, no issue with picture quality at all.  It's just I already had a Lumix 18X zoom camera that I really liked.  In direct comparision, I still prefer the Lumix over this Canon.  The Lumix is more compact, the shutter of the Lumix is more precise, the Lumix lense does not stick out as long at max zoom.The canon has longer zoom, but it's really only practical for stills on a tri or monopod as the IS cannot compensate for much movement at full zoom.  The variable angle display is useful and the fit and finish are first class as in all canons.  The shutter has some delay between pressing and actual picture taking.  This may be my biggest disabpointment besides the inability of the IS to work well at max zoom.  Due to that I really haven't been using it as much as my old reliable Panasonic Lumix with only 18X optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Best camera we've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Nancy R. Cleveland
Reviews.Content: Took this to Costa Rica and shot magnificent pictures of monkeys, birds, frogs, etc., none of whom stayed still and posed!  The pictures were sharp and clear - fantastic image stabilization.  This is a point-and-shoot camera that really delivers.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: maeva
Reviews.Content: After some web research, I purchased this camera for concert photographing. It makes good quality photos in bad light conditions and amazing close-ups from even a seat quite far from the stage. The only con is a bit slow reaction but I'm sure this is the best product in its category.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: jkaelber
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this camera and it's totally fit the bill for what I needed!  Love that I can take multiple pictures in an ice rinknow and not have to wait for the camera to warm up again!

Reviews.Title: 5+ for the zoom
Reviews.Author: Kannan Govardanan "LG"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my brother as Christmas gift. He loves it! I own a Canon Rebel T3 DSLR. The zooooooom on this SX40 is amazing and beats T3 by some distance!

Reviews.Title: Good digital camera
Reviews.Author: Hrachya Seyranyan
Reviews.Content: It's amazing camera with 35x optical zoom and it takes very bright shots even in a darkness without flash lighting. The only think that not satisfied me it's a matrix density, i need more pixels ... maby 20MP. Overall i like it !

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me...
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Briones
Reviews.Content: I don't like those big cameras, to heavy and you need to chance lenss for far or close pictures. This is the perfect camera for that. You have ALL IN ONE. Amazing zoom, a great vibration control, a bunch of digital resources for videos and photos. GREAT CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Brian in Indiana
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for travel photography.  Long ago, I used to have a 35mm film SLR with a variety of lenses.  I have more fun with this camera because I don't need to carry around several lenses.  Takes great digital pictures.  I wish it had more video settings for slow motion videography.  I also wish it had time-lapse capability.  I love the 35X zoom.  The newer SX50 has a larger zoom at 50X.  I won't upgrade over the extra zoom but think new buyers should consider it versus the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Gunderwood
Reviews.Content: A bridge camera. It is nice, I really like it but wish I had gone straight to a more expensive DSLR now. It cant hook up to a involumeter to do time lapse videos and you cant change lenses, but it,s a great camera with exceptional zoom and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Dolores Ford
Reviews.Content: I have not had the chance to use this camera much yet.  We are going from fall to winter and the landscape outside is not very attractive right now.  I am pleased with the zoom and have to get used to the viewer opening to the side.  Looking forward to using it on our Alaskan Trip.

Reviews.Title: its great
Reviews.Author: lrowley
Reviews.Content: this camera take very good pictures. I'd like it a lot. It was a good investment and not so expensive

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera, until the ability to take videos broke
Reviews.Author: Jes
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, but I've heard it's being discontinued for the SX50 HS which has a nicer LCD. I just set the camera to take continuous shots and always take 2-3 shots. The first one tends to be blurry, and the second one perfect. This is also a great setting for capturing good pictures of kids.After about 4 or so months of owning, the ability to take videos just stopped working.. now they all end up distorted. I've tried 3 different SD cards of different sized and such, but with the same results. Kind of sucks as it was nice to be able to take a quick video with it, but it does take much nicer photos than videos anyways.

Reviews.Title: SX40
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: My first advanced digital camera. It takes very good pics and is easy to use. Wish you could choose RAW format. Nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jacquelinanne
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Africa. I used a little Nikon point and shoot which took very good videos and pictures. I was happy with the camera until I compared my shots with my traveling companion's. Hers were better particularly when using the zoom. Much better. Our guides and drivers wanted to take pictures for her so they could use her camera and some said they would buy it. The battery life seems exceptional and the charger is simple to use.  I have not yet downloaded anything from the camera so I don't know if that will be complicated

Reviews.Title: Love my Cannon!
Reviews.Author: Myrella Lara
Reviews.Content: Love the price,too!  This was a replacement for a Nikon Rebel.  Like this Cannon much better! It has a playback video mode that loops a snippet of all videos together, like a mini preview..?  We took this camera toItaly and got great pictures and videos.  We have been taking great pics with our I Phone as well but I still need a real camera in my hands.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Luis M. Gomez
Reviews.Content: So simple to use and give the best picture from the first moment. I recommended. This camera is very friendly to use, and at the same time allow to make picutres on good quality on momnets that is require pro equipment.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - lens not clean
Reviews.Author: KF
Reviews.Content: I opened package, start charging battery, assembled strap and lens cover.  Read "Getting started" guide.  Battery seems ready (although not fully charged) so inserted battery and SD card (Amazon basic) and ... hmm, I found dirty spot on my brand new camera!  I took couple of pictures anyway, and did not see much problem, but I want nice clean new lens so this one is going back.  Since I was not able to replace it,  immediately made another order.From few pictures I took, this is a nice camera!  I never used this large camera but it definitely take a lot better picture than my old Exilim.

Reviews.Title: Concert Photos
Reviews.Author: C. Henson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use at concerts since they won't let you bring a DSLR.  I bought it the day before the concert so I didn't get much time to play with it but the pictures came out fantastic and I had no idea what I was doing!! Im sure if I had more time to play around with it I could've taken better pictures.  For reference the concert was at night.  The zoom was great! There was a lot of bass at the show so the audio wasn't the best but nothing I couldn't clean up in iMovie. I would've posted the video but it was a Drake concert so the language is bad. I did post some photos to give people an idea of the possibilities. I also had no problem getting in the concert with it so I will keep it for other shows.

Reviews.Title: Everything I Expected
Reviews.Author: Rocketman
Reviews.Content: Has to be the best point-and-shoot camera on the market. I suppose it would qualify as an entry level enthusiast camera. Outstanding functionality (I haven't yet used everything it can do) at a price that is right for someone who is not a super-serious photog.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Hikeguru
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  Zoom is great for getting close photos and image stabilizer works well for me since I have a tendency to be shaky.  Lots of great features.  I am still learning the camera but exceeds my expectations.Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD.

Reviews.Title: settled on this one after many attempts to find "the one"
Reviews.Author: wisconsin wildman
Reviews.Content: i've been searching for a bridge camera that would rival an slr/dslr for a long time.  i went through more than ten attempts. i really liked the panasonic fz150, but it's low light image quality was not good.  the sony hx100v had super video, but it was slow and had soft picture quality. i tried all the different settings i could to fix these issues. early in my search i did try the sx40, but had some issues with the lens motor.  but after all the cameras, i came back to it and am very happy.  it does not have video quality that matches the sony or panasonic (they both had the avchd video which is higher quality).  but as far as still images go, you can't beat it.  it will be the closest in any high priced bridge camera you can come to a dslr.  i took an image on auto of my cat inside (good lighting) and it came out fabulous.  it did seem to set a rather high iso-1600-but i had it printed to an 8x10 and it shows little if any noise-something the high end panasonic and sony won't do. i do wish it had a remote shutter release option. and i do wish it was as fast as the panasonic, but for most pictures it is so much better.  i bought a 58mm lens adapter here on amazon so i could put a filter on it (don't buy cheapie uv filters as it will degrade your photo quality and can mess up your focus).  and i also purchased a rubber collapsable screw in lens hood (about $5).  then i can use both filters and the hood together. or hood alone, or filter alone. after market batteries are really cheap and long lasting too (i bought two). even though i'm not a big fan of the video it produces (it's ok, but could be a little better-spoiled by the sony and panasonic, so if i had never seen them, i wouldn't know), it was the best of the three high end cameras for image quality. another advantage is that this camera is slightly lower in price. i do believe i'm pretty qualified to write this review as i've tried out over 10 cameras before sticking with this one!!!!  i think you'll like it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Zoom
Reviews.Author: Venky
Reviews.Content: This is my first Point and Shoot camera . My choice was Nikon p500 and Canon SX40. It was amazing to choose canon especially zoom with clear picture.Low light performance also was very impressive.I have chosen this camera after lot of analysis like image stabilization ,picture quality , low light performance etc. So far it's meet my expectation except the noise while Zoom .

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Kimberly K. Lewis "kimberly"
Reviews.Content: I had an SX5 so this was a step up.  I haven't had it long enough to really write a good detailed review but so far it is great.  I did have to purchase the screen protector and polarized lens covers separately to protect it.  The zoom is awesome - it handles well.  My only beef so far is that they changed the on/off to a button and it is too easy to hit it while stowing in my camera bag which is irritating.  Never happened when you had to push a lever to turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Happy until I found about ISO limitation
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera and I was really happy with it. The overall quality is good. You can take some nice pictures and videos. Now, Yesterday I was playing with it with the intention of taking some starry night shots. I was extremely disappointed to notice that with long shots (more that 1 second exposure time) you can't use a higher ISO than 100. I have no idea why is that, but I've read other reviews about this issue and it is real. You can google "ISO speed is limited due to slow shutter speed". This limitation is difficult to understand since older cameras didn't have it. This is clearly a deal breaker for me, since doesn't allow you take night pictures with the camera's full potential. It is incredible to believe that anyone can think it is a good idea to include such limitation in a camera that has a full manual mode.Canon, seriously???

Reviews.Title: broken camera after only 8 months
Reviews.Author: Robert Bayer
Reviews.Content: After only 8 months of use the camera broke.  The seller will not replace it, so I will be trying to obtain a replacement or repair  from the manufacturer.  I will repost a review if i am successful.  A broken camera deserves a rating of no stars...

Reviews.Title: Great camera for 16 months only
Reviews.Author: Liz H. Kelly
Reviews.Content: I LOVEd this camera for 16 months, especially the 35x zoom. The video is also sharp, and I get a ton of complements on my photos. However, after 16 months, my photos are blurry unless I hold the camera very steady with both hands and hold my breath. 90% of the time I use the camera in Auto so it should not be this complicated! I took photography classes at an art college and am a reporter so I am not a new photographer. I have never seen this issue on any camera in 20 years - yet my friend/camera geek told me that he has also had recent problems with his Canons so something is slipping in the quality control department.FYI, I am having the same problem with another Canon that is a smaller size, but also about 1.5 years old and lost some really important pictures last week when I gave the camera to a friend in Auto. I tried to explain please hold the camera really steady, but all of the photos by friends came back blurry :(I called Canon, and they said it would cost $160 just to find out what is wrong with this camera, and $100 to find out what is wrong with the smaller Cannon. No thanks! I am now buying Nikon cameras because a camera should not break at 16 months (the guy at Canon told me a camera should last 7 years???) Please Canon, fix your cameras!

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Eeyore's Dad
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, it's a "High End" point and shoot,takes great pictures and is easy to use! It does what I bought it to do and if you want more from your camera buy a DSLR....Also I got a better deal at Best Buy and brought it home with me that day, didn't have to wait on Amazon's slow shipping(and had to pay tax no matter what soooooooooooooooooooo)

Reviews.Title: The Camera
Reviews.Author: Krishnan
Reviews.Content: There's no need to read lots of review for a camera. Because the sample photos are the proof.I have gone through lots of reviews and when I reached here, I saw the real difference.Stunning Images the users uploaded here. I have only seen such images on top news and magazine websites. Thoseare of course taken by professional photographers.I have myself taken the photos and found that the images are crystal clear and came with real colors.The interesting thing is this camera gives clear pictures for normal as well as zoomed images.I have not yet used the flash.I have never seen such a clear photos on other reviews. Once I saw these photos, I have notwaited. Directly added to cart. Within 3 days, I got the camera.The only problem is it's big and heavy. You cannot put it in your pocket.But it's worth it. The video too is very good.Note:Please keep a standard SD card handy or order together. Because, without it you cannotuse the camera.

Reviews.Title: far exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Lewis
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for a trip to Kenya; 12 days and 1600 pics later (and 30 minutes of HD video), three people have said they're going to buy THIS camera based on the quality of my pics.Amazing image stability feature, as I took some pics at full digital zoom without a tripod and the pics turned out perfectly.Other people on the safari noticed the ease of use of the camera, as I was getting lots of shots while they were still trying to figure out how to work theirs. And 99% of the time I just left it on AUTO.The only critical comment would be that the image write time is a bit longer than I expected, which affects the ability to take the next photo. I had it on the 'M2' setting, 1900x1200, where each pic is about 1 MB, and was using a Sandisk Ultra 32 GB mini card. Large files, yes, and of course a smaller file would probably write more quickly.

Reviews.Title: love the zoom
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: i take pictures using a tripod and need a very long zoom.  i do not want to cary around many different lenses and pay such high prices for them as well.  this camera is great for having a point and shoot with all the great features of dslr.

Reviews.Title: CANON SX40 HS
Reviews.Author: rajesh
Reviews.Content: Super Zoom . Super MAcro.. Super color efficiency .. Nice camera to prior to DSLR ... Value for money. Good balance of Pixels and zoom.Canon SX40 i feel its go to camera ....Aperture effect if awesome ...

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: silverd2
Reviews.Content: What a great camera. The zoom is great for taking pictures of wild life. A little bigger that a hand held but well worth the money. Used it last year on a trip around the USA

Reviews.Title: Great camera, bad memory card!
Reviews.Author: Ron C. Lauder "Spiderweb95060"
Reviews.Content: I am a novice photographer, just a point and shoot guy really.  I was excited about the zoom and other functions on this camera and it was working great for the first couple of months - then the memory card up and died.  A 'memory card error' message came up and I lost all my footage.  It was a Transcend 16g class 10 SDHC card.  What if Bigfoot was on there, or a legit photo of UFO's or aliens!!  I'm pretty bummed right now and am waiting to hear what Canon has to say about it.  In reading the manual, it does say something in there about "some brands" of memory cards behaving differently.  No specific incompatibility issues mentioned though.Other than this card issue, which pretty much renders my camera useless right now until I figure it out, the camera is awesome.  I zoomed in on some birds from my backyard and got incredible detail and clarity.  Took some photos of people surfing from a cliff pretty far away and was really happy with the results.  If only I could see those photos...See my comment about the memory card being at fault here and not necessarily the camera...card has been sent in for replacement.Review Amendment:  I put a working memory card in and things have been going great.  Went to the Pinnacles over the weekend and took some amazing shots of condors from a million miles away.  Couldn't be happier with the camera - just waiting on Transcend to send me a replacement card which will hopefully make everything right with the world.  Sad about my lost videos and pics, but such is life...

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: RAFFY
Reviews.Content: This Camera is excellent for a gift . I bought the Cameras for my brother who was visiting this country

Reviews.Title: For me, 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with my Canon SX 40.  It's a step-up for me from the Canon Powershot SD 850 IS I've been using.  My photos are wonderful - I've taken some great shots of the moon.  I like the ability to adjust settings or have it automatically set.  The telephoto lens is good too.  I'm still learning, but this is the perfect camera for me.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on the numerous positive reviews and I'm completely satisfied. Easy to operate, simple instructions and great picture quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: 4 out of 5
Reviews.Author: Mary Jean Ferris
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've owned so far. Easy to program and takes the best photos with very little adjustment on my part.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this Camera
Reviews.Author: HAPPY CAMPER
Reviews.Content: I'm not a pro at taking pics, but this camera seems to do the job, macro quality is very nice, not super fast, just fast enough, action pics beautiful, works beautiful under any lighting,easy enough for beginners, lots of features, you would not regret purchase of this product. Worth the price,recommend.

Reviews.Title: Camara & Accessories
Reviews.Author: LaVon
Reviews.Content: The Canon is an excellent camera.  The advice on the correct memory disk helped in completing the package so I could use it once it was shipped.  The camara is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: SX40
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: GREAT camera, my only complaint is the digital screen opening to the side, takes a little practice with the screen off to the left. bought the 32GB memory card. like I said GREAT CAMERA, still learning all the functions.

Reviews.Title: I really like this one
Reviews.Author: JIA
Reviews.Content: this is the first camera I got with 35x optical zoomamazing! And I also bought a camera bag for sx40Case Logic DCB-304

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: kmcconnell
Reviews.Content: I just received my Canon SX 40 HS and absolutely love it! It takes beautifully clear pictures, has amazing features, is easy to use and I love the 35 zoom! I can't wait to try it out in Yellowstone and Grand Teton National parks this fall!! The price is also nice. :)

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: saycheese
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX40HS is a fantastic camera. The 35x zoom is great for wildlife photos. I was going to purchase a DSLR and then saw this one. I would have spent so much more buying camera and lenses. Also this fits in my purse so I have it with me at all times. I love all  the cool effects it has like the low light, fish-eye, color swap, etc. The quality of the photos are great. It's easy to hold and the vari-angle LCD works well for different photo situations. I am so pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: R. Rucker
Reviews.Content: Received the camera when promised and found the camera was as promised. It was in great shape when it arrived and takes nicephotos. Impressed with all the features built in but not sure I will utilize them for a while.  Lots of new stuff to learn. Amazon is great!

Reviews.Title: Electric viewfinder
Reviews.Author: John  Sheppard
Reviews.Content: While it is a very good camera for what it is intended to do, it has flaws.  The screen resolution of the monitor is very poor for this type camera.  My Canon S-95 is worlds ahead of the SX-40 monitor.  Next disappointment is the Electric Viewfinder.  It is incredibly DIM!!  Almost useless in bright sunlight.  Again, my Canon S-95 out shown this camera with its brighter monitor!  How could this be??!!  This is an ADVANCED camera!  The only reason I bought the SX-40 was for the wonderful zoom range.  I like to isolate my subjects and a 24-840 zoom range allows me to really get close.  However at extreme ranges, you MUST have a steady platform, a brace or a tripod, anything to steady the camera.  You will see what I mean if you buy the camera and try and hold it steady!  But that is expected.  Know its and your limitations.  The image quality is very good.  And remember:  Most people never have a print made bigger than a 4 X 6 anyway!!  IF they even bother to have prints made.  Most people just look at their photos on their PC.  So this is a good choice for many folks who don't NEED anything more than an all in one camera.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: phoenix
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift at the end of 2011. It was significantly better than the Canon SX20 and had got positive feedback from the person who I had gifted to. After few months the camera started giving a lens error and the camera became unusable. After looking in the net for similar problems I found that this is a known problem and if you are lucky the camera starts working after a restart. In my case, the camera kept throwing the same error after restart.I wouldn't recommend the canon point and shoot till they fix this issue.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Ozzy
Reviews.Content: I have never owned a Canon brand camera before and after using a family member's SX30 I decided that it was time to upgrade from my old point and shoot. The seller shipped fast and I got the product in one piece without any damage whatsoever. On to the camera; The SX40 is an amazing camera for the price. Top features include the zoom and the ability to set the f stop and shutter speed. With many more features that I can type about, I am very happy with my purchase. It would be nice to be able to save in raw, but this camera is less than $400 so I can't complain. Overall I am extremely happy with the image quality and I will look forward to buying more Canon products in the future, quite possibly from the same seller.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Mehta "SCM"
Reviews.Content: Have to admit, I am not a pro photographer but have used all brands, canon, nikon, yashica, olympus spanning over 25 years...Before I bought this camera, I had bought a Nikon P500, about 2 weeks ago.While using the P500, i noticed the following:1. At full 36x zoom, it's almost impossible to use the camera without a tripod. The stabilization is so poor that I just gave up taking shots without a tripod. Even then sometimes, the picture would be not very sharp.2. When using the HD movie recording mode, you cannot zoom in and out without losing clarity.3. While using the movie mode, you can hear the zoom motor in the recording. It's not bad when there is other noise in the recording but if silent then you can clearly hear the zoom motor at work.4. In low light conditions, the Nikon did not perform well. Especially if you try to take a shot without using the flash. Sometimes with the flash, the pictures were too bright.Frustrated, I started looking for "superzoom" cameras which offer the same optical zoom. After intensive research, i settled on 2, the Canon SX40 HS and the Panasonic Lumix FZ150. Although the Panasonic has got higher marks by the pro's, I selected the Canon due to the lower price and my overall experience with the Canon name.Glad, I selected the Canon. This is a awesome camera. The image stabilization is so good, i don't need the tripod when using the max 35x zoom. I can take superb pictures without having to carry around a tripod. Indoor pictures, especially in low light is staggering. The difference between the P500 and the Canon is like heaven and earth.I also love the continuous mode, where i can take pictures of my kids and family without having them to stand still...In short, I love this Canon and highly recommend it to anyone looking a superzoom

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Courtney Gainey
Reviews.Content: After a great deal of comparison shopping, I decided on this product. I am exceedingly pleased with this camera. The zoom capability for distance is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera purchased from Amazon
Reviews.Author: C. D. Woodfin "danwoodfin"
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3-4 digital cameras. I am not a professional photographer but use the camera in my work as a professor of architecture. I researched digital cameras in this price range before making this purchase. This camera has lived up my expectations. The wide angle lens is perfect for my architectural photography needs. The fast lens permits good photographs in low light. I am completely please with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the amateur
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera a few weeks ago, and it is perfect for my needs.  I chose this camera primarily because I wanted a long zoom lens as I am going to the Galapagos in the summer.  I used it this week to film a middle school jazz band concert.  I was filming from the mezzanine, in low light, and the HD video came out great.  The only drawback is that the controls aren't very intuitive and it takes a little time to figure them out.  Once you get the hang of it, it is an easy camera to use.  This is a camera for someone who wants to upgrade from a point-and-shoot.  This is probably not a good fit for someone who prefers a DSLR.Pros:  Long zoom lens, good picture quality, good video quality, easy to use, not too heavy.Cons:  You need to play around with it initially to get used to the controls; not a camera for the sophisticated photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera with great features
Reviews.Author: John Pfeiffer
Reviews.Content: Picked this one up locally (had an issue with Amazons shipping).  Not much to say except it's the best digital camera that I've owned out of 8 since 1999.  Not quite a super pro camera, but for the non-pro, it does everything you'll ever need including very acceptable 1080HD video (not quite as good as my dedicated JVC camcorder), but a perfect alternative when a camcorder isn't available. I've only spent 6 hours with it, but can say that it's one amazing camera. Battery life is a bit short, but only if you zoom a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great step up from a little pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Stay at home Mom
Reviews.Content: Great step up from a pocket camera without going to SLR. I still have much to learn, but very nice photos so far, and its a great looking camera. Very happy with my decision, and I did a fair amount of research on comparable models.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX 40 HS Digital Camera ( LOVE THE ZOOM QUALITIES)
Reviews.Author: Jan K.
Reviews.Content: I just received this Camera. I am no expert, as my family will confirm. However, I like the possibilities this camera affords my picture taking skills. I have the option to become a better photographer and yet I can simply shoot great pictures. I like the non-shake ability and the zoom capabilities. This camera seems just right for me. Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX40 HS - Ibuysonline.com
Reviews.Author: Casi
Reviews.Content: The camera has been acting up since day 1, but I continued to use it as the error does not occur every time I start up the camera. The error is that at start up it the camera display states "lense error" and just freezes. The only way to get the camera to close is to take out the battery. After that you it usually starts up fine.I have now had enough of it and contacted the vendor for advice ibuysonline.com - 3 emails later I still have not received any kind of response from them and it is starting to frustrate me. They were very good at delivery, I wishe their customer service support was as good as their sales team.

Reviews.Title: Like this camera, however a few issues. Maybe someone can help
Reviews.Author: Suzie Snowflake
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in November. I am happy with the zoom for sure. Not happy with indoor people shots. They are either yellow or pale. People's face color is either yellow or pale also. Distortion with sizes of surrounding things is not good either. When I want to crop, the cropped image is not crisp (all types of pics). I really thought this camera was going to be the bomb. I owned a SX210IS which took better pics than this for cropping and with indoor lighting. I have changed the settings to tungsten while shooting with fluorescent lighting. It got rid of the yellow, but looks flat and just not right. Can't put my finger on it. I do not know terribly much about settings. I do know that the SX210IS worked perfectly on auto, this one does not at all.

Reviews.Title: Junk!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The zoom is very 'optimistic' ( creatively calibrated), motion detection does not work well at all and I was sorely disappointed. Called for a return and refund the day after I received it. Still haven't seen a Canon SX series camera worth having.

Reviews.Title: OK to a point
Reviews.Author: Ron McKinnon
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, seems to work best on "auto" but can't understand why they don't give you option of hard manual instead of CD (other than it saves them money)

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Matt J Holdsworth
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely in love with this camera.  Ive had it for almost 2 years and couldnt be more happy.  It takes great pictures nnd the zoom is incredible.  Being an amateur photographer I just like to take pictures for fun... mostly landscape and space photography and it perfomms great.... im always learning new techniques on how to improve my skills (recently got into HDR photography) and this camera does everything i want.  I downloaded the CHDK so i could get passed some of the restrictions and take longer exposures and it made me love the camera even more.  One other thing i should mention is that i left the camera out ALL night in th  pouring rain and was freaking out.... to my pleasure the battery pack compartment was bone dry and the camera started right up and works good as ever....i recommend this camera to any amateur photographer who isnt ready to shell out the money for a full DSLR and wants to hone their skills... im saving up for a Canon DSLR to keep going with this great hobby... thankyou Canon for a great camera... wouldnt buy any other brand now!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my skill level but.....
Reviews.Author: Gxd
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures. I love the fact that I dont have to change lens to zoom.The only thing I have a problem with is  that the pause between snapping pictures and registering the shot is too long.I.ve changed the speed and it.s still slow.  The nikon was better.  I chose the Canon because I.ve  owned about 6 or 7 Canons and they a similar in ease of use.  Film and digital.Again, the big bonus was the zoom lens with out carrying all the excess lens. 40 x!!

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: Jardel A. G. Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Excelent brigde camera, lot os manual customizations and features. Canon and Nikon are the most famous good brands for photo's equipament.

Reviews.Title: Increible
Reviews.Author: Juan M. Hidalgo
Reviews.Content: Las fotos que he logrado gracias a esta camara no tienen precio. Sinceramente una calidad increíble.100% recomendable, buen precio y buena calidad por lo menos para el uso "domestico", viajes, vacaciones...

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: i think there are enough detailed reviews about this camera.. all i have to say is that the zoom on this is amazing.. there are a few software limitations that could be fixed with firmware hacks and upgrades...

Reviews.Title: Excelent...!!
Reviews.Author: Luis Mier y Teran
Reviews.Content: This camera is excelent... The pic's are beautiful, it doesn't looks like a 12.1 mp camera... Is BETTER!!!La camara es excelente... Las fotos son hermosas y no parecen de una camara de 12.1 MP. Se ven MUCHO mejor.

Reviews.Title: Me encanta
Reviews.Author: Maria Delgado
Reviews.Content: Me encanta, es muy buena cámara, es el mejor regalo para quien quiere aprender fotografía artística o profecional. Fue una excelente compra

Reviews.Title: Good but with details
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: After a few weeks with the camera are just a few points against:The camera's optical viewfinder has a horrible aspect, as to bring your eye to the viewfinder is a digital image that loses all the actual colors of the image, the resolution is horrible and it is very difficult to operate in this way, which makes the chamber must always be operated by slowing LCD time duration of the battery charge.Otherwise the camera has excellent performance ... The zoom lens is shocking, is really amazing.Video recording is also excellent.If you want to have a digital camera with lots of toys to make your photographs something a little more professional and easy to use, this is the caara you are looking for.But if you want to get a camera for more professional finished yet to invest in a rebel.

Reviews.Title: It does what it's supposed to.
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Bajek
Reviews.Content: I own a S90,s95 and have owned a bunch of other canon non super zooms, this is my first larger canon and my first superzoom.It does a decent job, it's certainly not pocketable like the smaller canons and I mainly purchased it for a walkaround long zoom camera.  The macro seems a bit finicky, but maybe that is just user error.It's certainly not my go to superzoom,  I also recently bought the panasonic 200 which is about the same size , but between the two it's by far the better of the two cameras for most shots.While the zoom suposedly tops out at 600 on the panasonic, it's essentially the same zoom ability as the canon.The panasonic seems easier to use (even though I'm pretty used to canons).  the burst and high speed modes are better on the panasonic, it's not even a close call, the zoom seems smoother, the video at least as good, the auto focus is faster on the panasonic and of course its better in low light due to the 2.8 .  But the canon is about 200 bucks cheaper and at under 400 bucks it's still a very capable super zoom.

Reviews.Title: Does its job admirably
Reviews.Author: Vince S. "Programmer, Gamer, Biker"
Reviews.Content: This product is exactly what's advertised. It's a solid camera with good zoom, sharp, clear pictures and movies, and it's a point and shoot.The main gripe I've had with it is that it zooms quite slowly. It also takes about a second or two to start recording, so plan ahead if you're trying to grab a sports hall of fame moment or something. Some of the frills aren't spectacular either; the 'fisheye' effect for instance, is pretty lame and doesn't seem to work too well.I don't particularly care about this, though, since all I wanted was a camera that worked well in low light situations and took good pictures. If you want to tinker with photography seriously, then it's probably better to get a refurbished DSLR than to pick up one of these, but if you want a solid camera without the hassle or learning associated with photography, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent image and video quality - great features!
Reviews.Author: HWWoman "HWWoman"
Reviews.Content: I will add to this as I become more familiar with this camera.Suffice it to say, though, that thus far this has been one of the best cameras that I have ever owned.I was able to purchase this after our Kodak Z990 was deemed "un-repairable" and we received a full refund of our purchase price, plus a pro-rated portion of our Best Buy warranty.  Best Buy recently had this camera for $349.This camera has all the features that you look for in a camera if you are looking for primarily an automatic "bridge" camera.  The zoom is amazing - up to 35x optical and 140x digital.  And you can even take photos at the 140x digital.  They may not come out sharp, but they are more than passable.  What a great spy camera for viewing boats on the water and people in them!  Or how about the people around a campfire in the dark at night? Or the cabins across the lake?  Amazing!The video quality is excellent also and you can zoom in and out while filming, but be forewarned that it takes a lot of memory.  We recorded a video that was just under 5 minutes and it was 1.2 GB in MOV format.  We could not upload it to Youtube or Picasa because the file size was too large.  I had to find some conversion software online to convert to a different format.  I was then able to upload to Youtube easily.I have not as of yet figured out how to reduce the file size for video or still images.I had several questions while connecting this camera to the computer (always have camera off when you are connecting or disconnecting), so I contacted Canon technical support and spoke directly to a live person in a matter of minutes.So far so good.More details to follow! Loving this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great potencial but time required to comprehend
Reviews.Author: janitorjim
Reviews.Content: Controls well placed for finger, thumb touch. A camera for the enthusiast  like this has lot of features, but even tho manual contains some perfuctory stuff it's 220 pages long.  I'm learning but am not satisfied with focus at max zoom.  Great service and price from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera SX40 HS
Reviews.Author: siri
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera it works great.  only concern is flash , I am unable to force the flash.  not sure their may be some hidden option for that.Overall it's Great Camera... my recommendation will be BUY.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera in Auto Mode - Not Good in Manual
Reviews.Author: SCarolina
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon SX40 because I had an older version that I liked and wanted a longer zoom without the weight and expense of a SLR.  Each version in this series seems to get worse and after a year of off and on use I'm giving up on this one.  If you use nothing but the point and shoot basic features on the auto setting then you will may like this camera except for some focusing problems pointed out by other reviewers.  When I tried to use the manual focus I found that there really isn't one.  The manual says to select "MF" and then turn the adjusting ring to get an "approximate" focus.  You than supposedly use the auto focus for "fine focus."  When I turn the ring when trying to manually focus as indicated in the instructions, then the slightest pressure on the multi-purpose ring puts the camera in a differnt mode.  The so-called "fine focus" does not work either.  Why go through all these useless gyrations and then end up using the auto focus button.  If I could focus with the auto focus on the shutter button I would not waste my time with the manual focus in the first place.The shutter lag on this model also seems to be much more than my older model. A faster memory card formatted with the camera helps, but it still appears slower to me and has caused me to miss shots.  As much as I like Canon products in general I would not recomment this model.  I would save the money I wasted on this camera and put in on a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Takes excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I wanted something with more power than the SX130 had, and the SX40 HS does the job very well.  The image stabilization feature allows me to take 140X zoom shots while just leaning against something.  It is nice not to have to have a tripod for such powerful zoom shots.

Reviews.Title: Two important issues for me with this camera
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Burton
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a professional photographer and I usually use a Nikon D300S and a Nikon D600, but I like a smaller camera to carry around as an everyday camera.  There are only 2 criteria that must be met on my "everyday camera".  This one failed both.  It must take good sunsets because I don't always have my professional cameras with me when I see a gorgeous sunset.  The other criteria is that it must have both a good optical and digital zoom.  (I use the digital zoom for Identification of species and for moon photos.)1)  I usually buy a Panasonic Lumix for my everyday camera, and it takes fantastic sunsets if you put it on the "Sunset" setting, but I thought I would try the Canon because it had a better zoom.  The person I spoke with on the phone from Canon said that this camera did not need a Sunset setting because it automatically sensed when a sunset was being photographed and made the proper adjustments.  I don't agree.  Either it is not sensing it, or it isn't making the proper adjustments.  I can't see a difference between the images from my Panasonic when it is not set on "Sunset" and this camera.  There is a huge difference with my Panasonic when it is set on "Sunset" and this camera.2)  I wanted a really good Optical Zoom and it had to also have a Digital Zoom available.  I use the Optical Zoom for most photos but I use the Digital Zoom for identification of bird species and for photographing the moon).  But the Digital Zoom is not available in the 3:2 aspect ratio setting and I keep my camera set on 3:2.  3:2 is the ratio you need for printing 4x6 photos.  Any of the other ratios require you to go into a photo editor and crop the image to a 3:2 ratio before printing your 4x6's.  Otherwise, the photo processing place will automatically crop it for you and it may not be cropped where it should be.  I had one place cut off the ears of a bear when it should have cropped off the bottom of the photo instead.  I could change it to 16:9 and take a photo of the moon and then set it back and then crop it on my computer later, but isn't that a bunch of extra steps when they could have just made the Digital Zoom available for all ratios?!So the only thing I like about this camera is the optical zoom being at 35x.  To me, that's not enough to make it worth the price I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Bridge Camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory A Hill
Reviews.Content: A little bit of history to start.  My first camera was a Minolta ST101 with a number of fixed focal length lenses.  Used for many years and then I went to a Cannon EOS.  I was thrilled when lens technology produced a 28-200 mm zoom.  It worked for 90%+ of what I wanted to do but it was big and heavy.Enter the digital camera.  My first was a 2 mpxl Canon Elph.  It took good pictures but not what I was used to.  It fit in my pocket though and convenience was a factor.  I went through several digital cameras as technology developed and my current unit (soon to be back-up) is a Panasonic ZS8.  It takes very good pictures and fits in my pocket.  The EOS was sold on EbayNow, I miss my SLRs viewfinder and all the settings I could adjust to tweak the image.  I do not miss hauling around a bag full of lenses and accessories not to mention exposed film. Enter the bridge camera now come of age.I did hours of research on various camera review sites and on Amazon.  I narrowed my choices to a Fuji HS30 EXR, a Canon SX40HS and a Panasonic FZ60.  On paper I had a difficult time as to which was the best one and ultimately ordered the Canon based open many prior very good experiences with Canon.  I also would have a good idea how to negotiate the camera settings pretty well.It’s a great camera.  I took pictures in the back yard of birds and squirrels, macros of flowers, kids at play and some landscapes with difficult lighting.  I took it on a weekend trip and took some night shots and beach shots and purposely pushed its limits.  I found it a bit slow to focus, especially at the long end and further still with lower light conditions.  I did not like using the motorized long lens and the viewfinder; it was somehow clumsy.I sent it back and got the Fuji HS30 EXR.  First thing I noticed was that focusing is quick and accurate.  I really like how the manual zoom feature works.  It’s a little thing but the size and grip feel better in my hand.The professional reviews made issues of the dots in the viewfinder and the LCD but I did not find those to be issues.  The menu in the Canon is easier to negotiate, maybe because I’ve been there before.  I find the Fuji lens to be plenty long enough but Cannon is clearly longer.  The Canon is better at exposure in difficult lighting but I am used to bracketing under those conditions.  Time will tell but the Canon’s face recognition appears to be better but I will more likely use my Panasonic ZS8 when taking people pictures anyway.When I made the purchase, I was trying to capture the best of a good pocket camera and an SLR and hence my interest in a bridge camera. Either of these cameras would have done the job but I think my heritage with a manual zoom has helped make my final decision the Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Satisfecho con el producto
Reviews.Author: Wilber Bernay
Reviews.Content: He recibido un producto en excelentes condiciones, el funcionamiento es genial, 100% recomendado tanto el producto como el distribuidor utilizado.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: Iowa Sunshine
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera without reading the guide which was installed as a shortcut on my desktop.I miss a printed book which is why I gave this a 4 instead of a 5.As stated by other reviews, the sound of the zoom is heard when you are recording.It does take great videos other than that.Amazon is a great online site for most everything. My favorite store.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX40 HS
Reviews.Author: Mohammed Ar Alawam
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate I have this camera. Easy to use great performance in semi-professional, but frankly Aanrfait is, in my view images with high resolution and clarity is excellent and I strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Love my new Canon SX40
Reviews.Author: greenrose
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning the various settings but it is getting better.  Only problem - no user booklet came with the camera but got some online info.  I take a lot of close up photos and they are good.  Light settings excellent.  Nice durable camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Arshid Khodai "AK"
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot camera you can't get much better and efficient than this! It is fast, great zoom and video quality is awesome!

Reviews.Title: pleased with camera
Reviews.Author: lisa
Reviews.Content: Just got my Canon SX40 and love the picture quality. This camera is perfect for someone who wants to upgrade from the pocket powershot type of digital camera, but isn't interested in a more advanced camera. I really didn't want a camera with all the different lenses, so this seems to fit my needs. Still learning all of the features, but so far I am pleased!

Reviews.Title: Major Design Flaw
Reviews.Author: oldivers
Reviews.Content: This camera has a major design flaw.  The front of the lens is threaded for what appears to be 52mm threaded accessories.  However the thread is not a standard pitch and 52mm accessories such as filters and lens shades will not attach.  Canon does make a filter adapter that bayonets on the outside of the lens but it requires you to use a 67mm filter.  This makes the lens cap useless and destroys the relatively compact lines of the camera.  In addition when the filter adapter is mounted you cannot use the lens shade.  When I called Canon about this they told me this was a simple point and shoot camera so they didn't think it was important to be able to mount a filter and lens shade together.  Oddly Canon describes this as a "High End Advanced Digital Camera" on their website.  This IS an advanced "bridge" camera designed for advanced amateurs and pros.  When I posted this review on Canon's sight they sent me an e-mail stating they were deleting my review.  I guess they can't handle the truth.  When I asked Canon what the front threads were for they stated they were auxiliary lenses even though Canon doesn't make any for this camera.  Third-party lenses are all designed for standard 52mm thread pitch and with a focal length range of 24mm to  840mm, what else would you need?

Reviews.Title: Noisy zoom - knocking lens sound - bad lens cover - inconsistent auto focus
Reviews.Author: kishorekp
Reviews.Content: NOT A PROF\AMATEUR VIDEO\PHOTOGRAPHER, but a point and shoot and auto focus user only.Saw about 20 test videos, 5 professional video reviews.  All profs catered only to other profs with high end, not understood to non-professionals who want to shoot day to day family\school\picnic\sight seeing\school events\kids sports etc.Had it for a day and tested for 4 hours.  I hv checked Sony HX100V, not extensively, and liked what I saw,  but intend to do so now, since I returned this unit.  I chose Canon over Sony because:- can shoot slow motion videos- can transfer files easily compared to Sony (Need to use converter s\w to convert .MTS files which is not a standard to play it in Vista, or any standard video players on computer)- almost 40 bucks cheaper- this one has 35 x compared to 30x (need to compare full zoom quality in both though)- BODY CONSTRUCTION: is very cheap plastic type construction, compared to Nikon P500 and Sony HC100V, but not a big concern.- BAD LENS COVER: lens cover barely sits in the groove, whose depth is barely enough to seat the cover. There is no tight grip of the cover to the camera body- FILE TRANSFER TO COMPUTER:  Just plug in the provided USB cable, to USB port on computer; copy and paste.  I didn't install software provided.  Have Windows Vista, which detected camera and installed drivers automatically.  Transfer rate is pretty fast. About 5 mts for about 1\2 GB.- NO PRINTED MANUAL: Need to use their PDF file.- NO DIGITAL ZOOM (FULL ZOOM UP TO 140X) FOR 3:2 ASPECT RATIO.  Meaning: if you regularly need standard 4 x 6 prints, camera needs to be set to to 3:2 ratio.  With that setting, digital zoom is set to off automatically (also mentioned in manual).  You are left with max of 35x optical zoom.  If you intend to use the digital zoom feature (until full 140x), need to set it to 4:3, which gives full 140x dig zoom, but then every time you need to take a 4 x 6 print you need to crop each picture (online or using a s\w) and also be aware of leaving that crop space every time a picture is taken.  Regular 5 x 7 print users have not problem.  This disadvantage is irrelevant for video.- DIGITAL PICTURE SIZE: I set cam to full 1080 HD, 4:3 aspect ratio (need for full zoom).  I shot my son playing ball\just trees around my home\some photos inside my home.  Approximate size of each dig picture is 1.4 MB to 2.4 MB. If you want to take continuous pictures in fast action like in sports (called burst mode, max 8 pictures in one click), file size is about 5 MB each, not sure why.- BURST MODE: is pretty good.  Used full zoom (140x) and shot hand held (no tripod) video and pictures of my son playing ball at a distance of 300-350 ft IN BURST MODE.  Both pictures and Video very good quality.  Am sure with tripod for that distance it would be great.  You need to switch camera to SCN (scene) mode for this function, since, you can't do in AUTO mode.  There is another continuous shots function under SPORTS mode, I checked it indoor and found to be very blurry (could be becoz of low light)- VIDEO FILE SIZE: 14-15 GB for 1 hour in full HD mode.  I have videos ranging from 10 sec to 4 mts. example (45 sec, 184 MB  \ 3 min 51 sec - 920,479 KB).  Consistent with Canon specs).  If you shoot at full HD, stock up 32 GB memories (found for $ 20 on sale)- TIME LAG BETWEEN SHOTS: It takes about 2.5 to 3 secs to take pictures from one to another without flash.  With flash, you at least 5 - 5 1\2 secs to take next shot.  Burst mode is the alternative.  Pictures blurry (auto focus mode) in low light. My 10 yr old dig cam is almost about same may be a 1\2 sec slow.  I guess that's the available technology for Point and shoot cameras.- INCONSISTENT AUTO FOCUS:  I tested with smoothest movement of zoom to fast zoom in and zoom out, with just only 35x optical zoom and full 140x digital zoom, then with smooth horizontal movement (panning) to fast horizontal moving, with absolutely no zoom (wide angle) to various positions of zoom  until max zoom.Result: Without zoom, quality is kind of acceptable.  With zoom, on this camera it was 50-50%.  Sometimes great, sometimes very annoying. When zooming in mostly, video was jerky, as if some portion of video was intermittently cut. 50% of the time camera struggled to get proper focus, need to zoom in and out to get it right.  In such videos, could see horizontal lines in the video.  Unreliable is the word.  (See below) Could be my camera was defective.- LOW LIGHT PHOTOS:  Excellent since I used only auto mode and I mean really low light, just a 40 watt bulb. My review is comparable with cheaper than this point and shoot, and equivalent cameras in auto focus only.- HOPELESSLY NOISY ZOOM:  Zoom makes considerable noise when zooming in and out, and its almost scary that makes you think if this is going to last long.  The saddest part (for which I returned the camera) is once you play back on computer or TV, the noise is horrible.  If you take quite videos rest assured it makes as much sound as there would be some fountain or waterfalls around.  As mentioned again, some videos are smooth to look at while in zoom, some of them have this jerks while zooming in and zooming out, very often loosing focus.  But in case it zooms well, then the pictures\videos are awesome.I guess zoom noise is a standard with high zoom cameras, its a personal choice to go with handy cam or buy a 2 in 1 bridge camera like this one- RATTLING\KNOCKING SOUND INSIDE CAMERA: This might be a lemon that I got. At every zoom you can hear a knocking sound physically while recording, which am sure is the mechanism inside or the lens not moving properly.  That probably explains the jerky movement seen in the video.  Knocking noise can be heard in the video too.  It sounds like someone beating a tin or cardboard around. Heard this in a couple of other videos on YouTube.  I have recorded about 15 mts video on Sony HX100V using zoom, but didn't have the zoom noise this bad and definitely not the knocking sound.  I am assuming that my camera had some defects.- BATTERY LIFE:  I used the camera in total to shoot about 45 mts video and about may be about 500 pictures.  Started using camera at about 5 pm to 5 pm next day with actual power on not more than 2 - 2 1\2 hours.  Battery drained out.  Seemed to be consistent with specs of cannon (they say max 380 shots if LCD used, which I did all the time)I wanted to upload the videos, but there is a limitation of 100 MB.  I will upload it to youtube and update this review with the linkReturned my camera, with the belief that my camera was defective, and that this model is really good (it had all signs of a great camera).  All those 5 & 4 stars could not be wrong, compared to the minority of 1, 2 and 3 starsRATING:  Deserves a 3 1\2 to 4 star, if knocking sound is not there and auto focus is not as bad in my particular camera.  But I give it 2 for now because I think, I got a defective camera.  Canon should ensure good quality.  I wouldn't give 5 stars because of the limitations I found.Will do same test again with my friends camera (same model). Will update to higher rating if my test proves that my camera was a bad luck, and not a standard equipment.  I bought it from one of the biggest chains FRY'S with the whole package sealed intact (sealed by FRY'S, not Canon)

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Daniel inc "GV AZ"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  So far, my only complaint is that I inadvertently hit the function buttons with my right hand when I am taking a photo.  This usually causes menus to pop up or the camera to go into view mode right when I want it to take a photo.  I'm sure I will adjust.  It is just is an annoyance that I would think would have been resolved on such an otherwise spectacular camera.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Marcela
Reviews.Content: I just love my new camera. I recomend it !! It is easy to use and take amazing pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: Might be last camera I buy.
Reviews.Author: 2EcuriouS
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after trying a Kodak 10MP 12X zoom which I didnt review very well.
